text: Orange with pepper and some coriander spice, soft grainy sweetness, cloudy with a nice soft mouthfeel

355ml bottle. Cloudy, yellow-ish, pale and bright golden colour with average, fluffy, half-way lasting, moderately lacing ,snow-white head. Wheaty, yeasty, spicy, fruity and citrusy hoppy aroma, hints of coriander, clove, orange zest and lemon. Taste is citrusy hoppy, slightly diluted wheaty and yeasty, notes of lemon, hints of orange zest. Superbly balanced, very refreshing.
Pale light yellow pour, quick white head. Nose is yeast and orange peel. Middle is lighweight malt , wheat body, spice, and hint of citrus. Finish is refreshing .

12oz bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is clove, banana, light citrus, and yeast. Taste is wheat, coriander, light citrus, and a touch of yeast. Dry. Decently bitter. Medium body. Moderate carbonation. Soft mouthfeel.

Very pleasant aroma, with white head and hazy yellow color. I enjoyed the smell more than the taste. It wasnt bad, but more spicy than sweet. I prefer sweet witbiers, such as Shock Tops Belgium White and Full Pints White Lightning.

I have been fortunate enough to personally meet founder Rob Tod and a few other Allagash people in Flanders years ago and I remember asking them about this beer, which at that point was the only one I knew of. Thanks to their love for Belgian beer culture, I had the opportunity to sample several of their creations throughout the years, but this one somehow had always escaped me so far, so Im glad I found a bottle now to submit to a tasting session. Medium thick, moussy, egg-white head, dissolving in the middle but leaving a dense, regularly shaped rim in the end, over a yellow blonde beer with greenish hue, slightly hazy at first (I did not rouse the yeast from the bottom first, contrary to the recommendations on the label) but becoming an equally misty, more ochre-tinged straw blonde with sediment. Aroma of soapy wheat of course, reinforced by soapy coriander, almost bath foam-like, but also hints of lime zest, banana, lemongrass, green apple, lots of gooseberry, sourdough, mashed potato, pear, straw, cloves and even very, very vague aniseed somewhere. Fruity onset, banana ester but mildly so, balanced with a hint of pear and a whole lot of green gooseberry, starfruit and slightly rhubarb-like sourishness, reinforced by the wheat sourishness below, which continues all the way to the finish, in a somewhat sharper, more vivid way than is the case in many actual Belgian witbieren. Carbonation is on the soft side, mouthfeel is fluffy and gentle, gliding over the tongue without any effort, enhancing the thirst-quenching properties of this beer. The sourish wheat gains an expectedly soapy quality in the middle, paired with sourdough-like barley; a bready note is there too, adding softness. Soapy coriander seed rises up in the finish, alongside citrus rind-sensations which add further fraîcheur, almost lime peel-like; way below, a soft and earthy, behind-the-curtains hop bitterness brings structure and welcoming dryness to the tail - and eventually even a brief moment of explicit herbal bitterness on the root of the tongue. It lingers a bit after swallowing, but the lovely bready yeast flavours, wheat soapiness and elegant spicing stay behind longer. Very Belgian indeed: it has the soapy wheat character, softness, thirst-quenching properties and expressive coriander spicing of any typical Hoegaarden epigone, but in a most elegant way; it is safe to say that this far surpasses the highly industrialized original of course, but it can just as well stand comparison with the best of the classic Belgian wits made by traditional family breweries in the range of Sint-Bernardus, Roman or Bavik, and easily so. I especially like the somewhat more outspoken sourish component and the volatile, gracile lemon rind-like qualities in the nose, adequately conveying the light, refreshing character of this old beer style. Witbier will never be my preferred style - within the classic European wheat beer family, I tend to lean much more towards German Weissbier, (originally) eccentricities like Gose and Berliner Weisse aside - but when I come to think of it, this must be one of the more pleasant and refined examples I had so far. Worthy of its reputation and I guess this functions well as an introduction to the style for the American consumer - in any case to be recommended way over Hoegaarden.
Bottle from beergium. Hazy straw yellow color. Thin persistent white head. Medium bitter, light sweet. Light acidic. Medium body. Dry. Aroma and flavour is coriander, yeast, citrus, herb.

So simple, so good. Beautiful soft mouthfeel like Tripel Karmeliet, despite the low ABV. A touch lemony tartness but mostly nice light Belgian flavor. Why I dont have this in the fridge all the time I dont know.
Pours a light hazy/milky yellow with a thick white head. Aroma of clove, banana, wheat and pepper. Taste follows, soft, crisp and refreshing. Perfect

Aroma: peach, apricot, cereal, some spicy notes in the background
Taste: light sweet, peach, apricot, cereal, bread

12 ounce bottle. Pours a cloudy pale yellow color. Small creamy white head. Yeasty, bready wheat nose. Sulphury notes. Subtle wheat malt flavor upfront has bready, hay-like notes. Spicy middle hints at lemon and coriander. Grassy hops with dryish notes in finish. Clean and refreshing.

Bottle from Whole Foods Market Fair Lakes
Aroma: bread, Belgian yeast, cloves, bananas
Appearance: hazy yellow with a white head
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate: light body, slick feel, soft carbonation, long finish, 

Tasty
Nice wheat smells. Pours cloudy yellow with a thin white head. Mild wheat beer taste. Crisp and refreshing. Nice.
Cloudy, very light yellow. Almost off white. Aroma is clove, banana, Belgian yeast. Taste is fruity, Belgian yeast. Dry finish.

355 ml bottle.

Hazy yellow with white head and plenty of lacing. Some spices in taste but more lemon.
Bottle to glass. Pours clearer than I remember. Pale yellow with moderate white head. Moderate spicy esters and spice aroma. Lemon and grainy finish.

On tap at the Dinosaur BBQ in Newark. It poured a cloudy gold color with a white head. The aroma was of toast, bread, wheat, light barnyard, cereal and some spices. The taste was similar to the aroma with some straw, wheat, lemon peel, spices and a touch of banana with a dry finish. Very tasty.
Bottle from Bigbys Pour House. Aroma of yeast, cloves and corriander. Quite smooth drinking from beginning to end.
On draft at the breweryit is a cloudy yellowish color witha white head. The aroma is wheats which has a flavor or coriander and wheats taste

Nice beer, had it from a bottle as they didn't have any draft at this place. Nice light golden color with a good taste and no aftertaste. As it says in the description, crisp, refreshing taste and subtle hints of spice, very nice

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Backlog, Many drafts over the last 10 years. I dont drink witbiers anymore but was a huge fan when I first got into the game in 08-09. Pours murky yellow golden with medium sized head. Smell and flavor are atraigh forward wit with clove, coriander, orange peel, wheat and other peppermint type spices. A nice example of the style.
Poured from a 12 oz bottle into a tulip. Very pale yellow, slightly cloudy, and with a thin white head. A pronounced scent of lemon. Light body, fizzy, fruity and refreshing.
Very clear and light with a soft scent, this beer has a refreshing soft taste thats not lasting and not bitter at all. Very true to its style and very sessionable. Great beer overall!

Appearance: Bottled 7/7-2015. Very slightly hazy pale yellow. Fizzy. Slight white head.
Aroma: Light fruits, banana. Wheat, slight spices.
Taste: Light wheat, some banana. Light fruits. Spices. Quite good.
Bought: Drinks of the World (Bern), 355 ml, CHF 6.50
Info: 14/10-2016, BB: 30/11-2016 (according to the importer)
On tap at World of Beer (Charlottesville, VA). Aromas of coriander, orange peel, light banana, floral. Clear gold with a fully lasting white head. Pretty dry, floral, citrusy. Light-medium bodied.
Draught at Toronado. Hazy yellow color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, wheat, banana, yeast and grass. Bitter finish with citrus, banana, wheat and grass. Good witbier.
12oz bottle at Claim Company in Northbrook. Light. Tangy. Fruit. Belgian yeast presence. Lemon. A solid wit, as ever. 13.4

I had this at Butch McGuires. Pours very pale yellow, cloudy with a white head. Taste sweet, citrus, Belgian yeast. I thought this was good, I would drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pours a golden color. Aroma and taste are citrus, some spices, and some wheat.

Fruity smell with a little Belgium yeast coming through. Taste is slightly sweet and fruity. Hard to finish. Not my style. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Hazy, straw colored with a white head. Pleasant fruity aroma with a hint of clove. Light fruity taste with hints of citrus, melon and spice. Just a hint of hop bitterness.
Hazy gold pour thin white head. Fruit Citrus slight Clove aroma. Smooth start to finish with light fruit that ends with spark of Clove Spice. Very drinkable. Perfect for summer hot day
On tap at Taps, Petaluma. This is great. Lovely citrus, fresh aroma. Taste is easy going orange, coriander flavour. Low bitterness, easy going, perfect summer beer. Nice.
Draft at the source on 5/17/2016. Pours pale golden and hazy with a white head. Aroma of wheat, honey, spice, mild fruit. Similar taste. Refreshing.

On draft at the Thirsty Pig. The pour is a foggy straw golden pour, very light, with a thin ring of head hat leaves a few spots of soapy lace. The aroma is intangibly wit. There is a strong wheat with a Belgian malt and a little yeastiness back on the end. The flavor is very similar. There is a bit of good strong Belgian malt and yeast with a hint of tartness right at the front. The flavor as it develops offers a good wheat and maltiness to it that isnt too bad. The mouth feel is thinner and light with a soft carbonation and a lingeringly malty Belgian wit finish. Its pretty good for a wit, Ill give it that. I just wish I liked them more.

Tap at The Thirsty Pig with koleminer20. Aroma is dry, banana, wheat, fruit, good. Appearance is pineapple juice, hazy pale yellow, white head. Taste is wheat, banana, tropical fruit, sweet and dry. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, light crisp carbonation, dry, tropical fruit aftertaste. Overall, this is a great Wit.
on tap chiara schiuma media torbida citrica speziatura delicata buona beva poco acidula

Tried at a restaurant on draft. Aroma was pleasing, fruity, bit of spice and honey, of course grains, but not heavy. Appearance is cloudy with a white medium head. Taste was very good. I do NOT like heavily hopped beers and that is one reason I love Allagash White. It is light, refreshing, and has a pleasant aftertaste that whispers "have another drink". This beer would be great with pizza, cheese and crackers, of course salty pretzels, and it even went well with Korean Barbeque Beef Bulgogi! I love this beer and will be getting it again.
Bouteille 355ml. Couleur jaune paille trouble, mousse blanche. Arôme de coriandre, citron, blé. Goût de citron, blé, coriandre, légère acidité, malt. Carbonatation moyenne-élevée, corps moyen.
Tap at Inn by the Bay in Portland, maine. Cloudy light yellow with small white head. Fruity spicy nose, . Taste is also sweet, citrus, crisp. Spice reminiscent of this style. A good white.

From the tap at Portland, ME Holiday Inn. Pint glass. Light straw colored with an unfiltered haze. Minimal head. Aroma is mild but lemon comes through along with grain/cereal. Taste is also citrus with wheat and cereal serving as balance components. Refreshing and easy to drink. Falls in line with many other mainstream witbier options. Orange, coriander. Thin with no attempt to linger in the aftertaste. Pretty basic but a good low ABV effort.

Im into lighter beers, as I cant stand hops. This beer does it for me. Its everything coors light, Miller light, and bud light are not IMO. Its refreshing and doesnt leave a heavy, lingering aftertaste. They got it right with this one.
Pours a cloudy yellow. Aromas of orange and spice. Flavor has too much orange, White beers arent high on my list. But this one wasnt that bad, had a little more of a crisp alcohol bite to it.

0,355 l bottle from Biervana 
cereal, herbs, citrus, dough, barnyard, pale, hazy, minimal head, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, light body, thin feel, fizzy,
Drank at Fetch in Warwic, NY on tap, Pours a beautiful yellow color, plenty of frothy foam. A beautiful looking brew.

July 23, 2015. On tap at Allagash. 
Clear golden with a small white head. Aroma is orange zest, coriander, notes of sweet peaches, grain, sweet malty, some grape, honey, almond, orange and spice notes. Taste is light sweet fruity with orange, peach, light bitter with some dry spicy notes of coriander and white pepper, light bitter, crisp spicy and fruity finish. 
Refreshing!

330ml bottle served in a Italian chalice glass. Pours and cloudy pale yellow color forming a small molasses white head with low retention and lots of lingering lacings left in the glass. Nose is sweet, malts and very spicy. Strong notes of sweet pale malts, wheat, honey, vanilla, coriander, cloves, orange zest. Notes of earth, black pepper, and flowery hops. Nose follows the nose. Slightly sweet upfront. Strong notes of wheat. Notes of sweet pale malts, wheat, honey, vanilla, coriander, cloves, orange zest. Notes of earth, black pepper, and flowery hops. Light body, medium carbonation. Spice, wheat and sweet pale malts in the aftertaste. Good drinkability. Great white beer. One of the best Ive ever tasted.

Served on tap at Moor Pat. Hazy yellow color with a white head. Citrus wheat aroma. Zesty citrus upfront with a mild wheat finish. Clean sticky light body. Easy drinking and crisp.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: SEP 7, 2016 I had it on tap.  It pours a pale golden color with a thin white head and lacing.  The aroma is coriander and citrus. The taste is coriander, lemon, yeast, and other fruit. The carbonation is nice. It is a smooth and refreshing beer. This is a solid choice. There are so many versions of this style. This is one of the better ones though.
Allagash. Always a fantastic selection. Delicious Belgian wheat. Light, right mouthful and coriander excellence going on.

I havent rated this yet!?!?!? One of these ended up in my fridge because my brother in law was visiting and doesnt like beer. Got this because its a great beer to convert people with. Beyond that... its still a great beer and Im enjoying sipping on it now. Allagash makes great beer. 

Coriander is big on this one. Did you know coriander is the seed of a cilantro plant? Yeah.... mind blown am I right.
Pours a hazy yellow with a long lasting foam head. Aroma is spices, coriander, citrus, pepper, and wheat. Flavor is similar, a touch on the sweet side. Has a carbonated mouthfeel. Good.
@ Commons Ale House, Santa Monica, 16-3-13: Mycket söt med toner av vete och skumbanan. Saknar fräschör.
On tap at The Commons Ale House, Santa Monica. Hazy golden with a white head. Soft and easy to drink with some choriander, wheat and some light yeast. An ok one.

I bought this by mistake. I dont like wheat beer almost as much as I dont like IPA. But this having been said this is not bad at all. I wont say its good but it is drinkable. It is too carbonated for my taste and lacks the malty flavor I enjoy but it is flavorful and since I only got a four pack Ill drink it as opposed to throwing it out. To me thats high praise.

On draft at Allagash (and many other places too!). Its so easy to overlook this beer because its getting ubiquitous on tap lists and this style because its not hoppy or in your face. However, its still worth remembering that this is a great beer -- lots of fruit notes from the orange peel, some spiciness from the yeast, and a good, smooth mouthfeel. A great, refreshing beer thats made extremely well.

WithZ, pours a hazy gold with a small white head, typical of a wit. Nose is very mild spice but all in all flat . Taste is mod spice, grainy and dull ! Finishes on the mild spicey notes , all in all a rather boring beer...but not a big wit fan ! Quaff Score 4 / 10
Bottle. Pours a clear golden yellow with a white head and aroma of spices. Taste is light, with spices, coriander, wheat, light yeast into the spiced finish.
Tap at Prohibition Pig, Waterbury. Colour is cloudy golden with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, citrus, wheat and malts. Pretty weak wit IMO.

Nice white ale. Reminds me of an authentic German wheat beer with the banana and clove flavor. All around very solid

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
pale gold color; light citrus and spices in the aroma; soft wheat malt with light citrus and corriander notes; a very smooth, well balancedwit beer; one of the best examples of the style

4-pack of 12 oz bottles from Uncork-It, Chicago. Hazy yellow appearance with a white head and light lacing. Aroma of Belgian yeast, bread, herbs, light citrus zest and light spices. Similar flavor, an easy drinking wit with a smooth finish over a light to medium body. Nice.

On tap at Smittys cinema, Biddeford, ME. Floral coriander, herbs, and zesty aroma with delicate orange blossom. Cloudy gold under a lacy, thin, white sheet. Bitter orange peel and slightly waxy coriander flavour that is zesty and delicate with a very light pilsner malt background. Medium light body, medium carbonation, zesty.
Pours cloudy blonde with a quick white head. Nose is standard citrus and slight tartness but is quite nice. Flavor is similar and fairly subdued. A decent white.
Bottle. Light with big white head.Another very fine brew from Allagash. Very flavorful.

I was blown away by this the first time I drank it. The second and third times, not as much--its a very good beer with great flavor youd expect from Allagash, but it doesnt hold up over time as well as some of their others do. Its a nice light color and has nice, wheaty notes, but beyond that, it doesnt hit you in the face with its flavor.
Allagash has to be one of my all time favorite brewing companies. Allagash White has to be one of the most smooth, clean and crisp beers I can drink continuously.
Staw colored and cloudy. Aromas of lemon, citrus, coriander, pepper and herbs. Flavors are sweet highlighted by the citrus and lemon with the herbal flavors coming in a second wave.

A little deceiving a first as it is not to intense on the nose but things pick up going down the hatch. Pepper, coriander, nutmeg, clove and banana from start to finish. Moderately spicy with a little tartness and a touch of sweet and sour. Light, crisp and refreshing. Allagash really nailed this one.

Served from a bottle to a weizen glass. Pours a troubled light gold with a frothy white head. On the nose, fruity yeast, orange and spices (cilantro?). Tastewise, a nice acidity and a citrusy taste. Theres a bit of bitterness in the finish. Impeccable white.
Cloudy, yellow color. Big , white head. Yeasts , lemon and spices in aroma . Tender taste , sweet with gentle but firm bitterness in the dry end . Highly drinkable and refreshing.

Pours a cloudy pale golden with a small white head that leaves nice lacing. Nose is sure enough of coriander and citrusy. Taste is spicy as well and dry, offers more coriander-derived citrus flavors. Body is light and carbonation moderate. Overall a benchmark for the style I would say, Id drink that again thats for sure!

Tap / Tirador.
@ Monks Cafe, Philadelphia, PA, USA
A: Hazy golden / Dorado turbio.
T/S: Cereal, wheat, slightly yeasty / Cereal, trigo, ligeramente a levadura.
(Tap) cloudy pale yellow colour with a small white head; aroma of lilies, lemon; balanced flavour with a long, light sour and bitter finish
White ale that is light and atypical but plays second fiddle to the likes of chainbreaker.

Bottle thanks to Gary in Portland. It pours cloudy gold with a decent white head. The nose is toasty, fresh bread, wheat, light barnyard, cereal and spice. The taste is crisp, clean, straw, quite dry, wheat, lemon peel, spice and a touch of banana with a dry finish. Light - medium body, fine carbonation and foamy mouth - feel. Well - rounded, clean and refreshing good witbier.
Aroma is sweet citrus, tart, and orange peel... taste is not as strong and a bit more jumbled, okay

On tap. Pours a hazy yellow with moderate retentive head. Aromas of coriander, wheat, and white pepper, Flavors carry same but watery with additional notes of yeasty wheat. Light in style but a nice quaffer.
Pours cloudy yellow with white head. Aroma is fruity citrus with herbal notes. Flavor is light malt with fruity and citrus notes and a herbal yeasty finish.

Overpriced, but I usually will order in the summer if on tap. Pours light straw color with thin white top. Not much lacing as the foam quickly disappears. Aromas or of ripe fruit and light ester. Flavor is banana with tang from the wheat. Pretty smooth, clean finish if a bit over-carbonated for my liking.

Light straw color with good size head that falls fast. Very lively on the tongue with good light wheat flavor and a very slight hint of banana. Nice, light and refreshing. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Cloudy but bright yellow. White lacy head. On tap at Pier 13, Hoboken. Yeasty Aroma. Citrus. Taste is similar.
Draft in tulip, scant head medium bodied pale yellow with slight orange tint. Bland white ale taste overlaid with great spice and orange peel nuance. Clean finish.

On tap @ Grillfish Washington DC. Pours a mild hazy yellow with a minimal white head. Aromas typical of a Belgian White (banana and clove). Tastes are banana and mild spice. Light body, nice bite on the tongue from the carbonation, medium spicy finish. Nice beverage. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy

On tap at the brewery. Cloudy very light hay colored with a white head, fine lacing. Light banana, fresh cut hay, light citrus. Slightest hint of bitterness, smooth sweetness. Light body, clean, shorter finish. Good.
Draught. Wheat and orange peel aroma. Pours a cloudy light orange with small frothy white head. Wheat, coriander and orange peel flavours. Quite sweet with some spicey notes as well.

On tap at the brewery. Served in a snifter. Hazy and very pale. Not much of a head. Smells of orange peel, spices, and wheat. Light Belgian yeast. Tastes mostly of wheat and spices. Some citrus peaks in the finish along with some Belgian yeastiness. Light body. Medium carbonation. Tasty example of a fairly dull style.
I hadnt rated this? Pours lemon color with a lot of white head from bottle. Smells yeasty and citrusy. Taste delicious. Well balanced flavors to malt. Not super smooth, but light bodied.

Legal Seafoods at Logan Airport has this beer on draft. Once you have had Allagash White on draft, you compare every wheat beer you have ever had to this beer. It is the best beer on draft ever. The company must get mad when its beer is consumed in any form other than draft.

Bottle.
Almost no Nose, slightly wheaty taste, with a Slight fruity finish. No bitternes.
Medium body, average carbonation.

On tap at Evernote in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is mild yeasty/floral fruits with mild sulphur coming through. Taste is soft and soapy. A mild wheat beer (which for me is not very exciting or refreshing).
Bread, citrus, earthy, clove. I love this beer, not available in MN. Refreshing drink.

UPDATED: JAN 27, 2016 07.09.15 ---Draft, Noc Noc. 
Black pepper spice, clove.
Mild lemon zest. Lighter carb, liquid smooth. 
Flavors are very gentle, considering a phenolic yeast and spicy notes. A bit sulfury on the back end but fits style. Delicious brew. 

01.26.15
Bottled, 07.06.15
Pale, straw yellow with a faint golden hue. Fizzy white head. 
Skunky like a green bottle, light egg, black pepper strong. Herbal, honey tea, sweet pils malt. 
Dull body, carbonic acid bite is washing out most flavors. Lingers with a egg drop soup flavor.

Bottle: Pale yellow color that was poured with a small white head that quickly dissipated. The nose was orange and lemon citrus with spices. The favor also added a sense of wheat. Very light body and easy to drink.
Tap at BTS. Hazy yellow pour. Tart, wheat citrus aroma. Clean wheat taste, tart and citrus notes as well as Belgian yeast. Very good.

Appearance- Clear yellow with a fizzy white head, not long lasting, average lacing.
Aroma- Citrus and coriander, wheat, peppery and spices
Flavor- Nice wheat beer, lemon and coriander, white pepper, some clove crisp and refreshing.

On tap at the brewery tour. Its an unclear yellow colored beer with a white finger-thick head. The aroma has citrus zest, grains of paradise and coriander. Vague pepper hints. Theres a light bitterness in the mouth, its medium bodied, dry and nicely carbonated. Citrus zest, some pale malts and spice notes too, I especially like the grains of paradise hint. Long citrus and spice finish. Sure one of my favorite wits, really lovely. 150609

Draught @ Allagash Brewing Company, Portland, ME
Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, wheat, orange and coriander. Taste is light to medium sweet and light bitter with a long yeasty, orange, wheat and coriander finish. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft to fizzy
A nice wheaty effervescent beer, some citrus along with classic witbier graininess. Okay beer.
Aroma geht stark in Richtung Nelke und Muskatnuss. Der Geschmack ist dann vorwiegend von Muskatnuss geprägt.

Bottle. Pours a hazy golden yellow with a slight white head with some lacing. Smells like wheat, bananas, white pepper, and lemongrass. Even though I have had this many times, I forget how good it is. The taste is Belgian yeast, banana, clove, peppercorn, nutmeg, wheat, grass, and lemongrass. Its so complex and refreshing at the same time. Great example of craft beer at its best in a great summer style.

Perfect for what it is. If you'd like a wheat beer, and you like a bit of citrus, this exceeds expectations. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
My favorite witbier so far. Lots of soft fruit in the aroma, and similar taste, with a soft but light palate feel.

UPDATED: AUG 28, 2015 One of my favorites of the style. Nose is coriander, some fruity (peach, banana) esters. Taste has nice spicy character (clove, white pepper), bread, yeast. Balanced and dry finish. Lovely, light, refreshing but not at all boring.
Not my favorite style by a long shot. Grain, citrus, banana, clove. I guess this is OK for the style but I dont really like wheat beers.

Poured into a glass at WFB event at Russian River. 
Aroma has a nice coriander note with some good citrus character. Nice, light wheat notes with some light pear and stone fruit esters. 
Pours a hazy, bright yellow gold with a small white head with good retention and nice lacing. 
Flavor has a hint of sweetness with a nice wheat note to it and some white bread. Medium coriander and some lighter citrus notes. Some good pear and stone fruit esters. Medium light bitterness and a medium light mineral quality. 
Mouthfeel is medium light bodied with medium carbonation and a bit of a soft character. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a nice witbier with good coriander and citrus notes. Nice water character and yeast esters.
UPDATED: MAY 5, 2015 4 oz pour from tap into sniffer at 42 degrees. Nose is clovey. Taste is light and crisp. Maybe hay and light fall spices.

Bottle from Hannaford Exeter NH. Aroma is strong pepper with citrus fruits and yeasty combination. Appearance is murky greenish yellow with good sparkle at the edges and two-finger width fluffy white head with good retention and foamy lacing. Taste is mild sweetness with pepper balanced with mild bitter. Palate is creamy medium bodied with brief lively carbonation at back of lips and tip of tongue before fading. Finish is wet and pretty long with light sweetness. Overall, this is a good beer that has some interesting spiciness to it. It isnt quite the powerhouse I was expecting based on its rating.

Beautiful golden straw color that poured very clear and then I dropped the yeast which clouded it up but still stunning. Aromas of lemon peel, Rosemary, and hay with the classic clove yeast. Taste is very refreshing with crisp character that is spicy up front with pepper notes and finishes with bubblegum and then allspice at the very end. A fantastic beer and a benchmark for the style.
Exactly correct for the style. Clove flavor. Slight citrus. Wheat bite. If you like the style youll like the beer.
Pours a cloudy dark yellow with an average size white head. Aroma was spicy and citrusy with some wheat and corn. Taste of wheat, spices and fruit and a light bitter finish. Light to medium bodied.
One of the better Belgian style Wits..hazy gold with fluffy white head..aroma of spices,lemon peel,bread..dry,crisp..not bad.
Golden orange pour with nice white head. Best flavors for this style come out. Lemon spice some phenolic yeast. Bubbly carbonation.

Probably the best Belgian white I've had; unfortunately not in Indiana so won't have again for awhile 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
16 oz draft in nyc cloudy white appearance. Aroma of orange and coriander. High carbonation. Light bodied. A bit of sour flavors.

12 oz bottle, poured into a tulip glass at approximately 40 degrees F.

Appearance: Pours a quite cloudy pale straw gold, and forms a massive white head with good retention. Lacing was exceptional throughout.

Smell: Musty wheat mixed with a bouquet of light fruits, from pear to lemon-orange citrus. Some hints of spiciness lurk within the depths of the aroma.

Taste: Spices hit straightaway, coriander, clove, and white pepper, before receding a touch to let fruit esters swirl in. Waves of white grapes, pears, and a mildly tart citrus bearing hints of orange and lemon hit and mingle. A faint tone of bubblegum arises towards the finish, which leaves a lingering tart citrus and peppery spice aftertaste.

Mouthfeel: Light and effervescent, this is a refreshing beer to drink.

Overall: A good witbier, solid in every aspect. Im a fan.
Une très belle blanche qui na rien à envier à nos blanches belges, fraîche, épicée, citronnnée longue et équilibrée.

A good Belgian white. Not too malty. Not too boring better than most white winter type beers

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

13.02.2015. 12 fl. oz. Bottle. Morton Eilliams Marketplace, New York. Golden orangne colour with white head. Aroma of wheat, yeast and orange. Very smooth and fresh beer. Soft, with low bitterness. Thisis a very plessant and easy drinkable beer!!
Draft - Orange and some coriander. Hazy yellow gold with a nice white creamy head. Citrus, earthy notes, spice and a dry finish. Not bad.
Pours a nice golden hazy yellow with a white head. Taste of wheat and spice.

Flight at brewery. For a style I dont really like, this is outstanding. Pours a hazy golden color- nice carbonation. Nice peppery and Belgian yeast and spice notes. Fruity and refreshing and super crisp. Pretty great.

UPDATED: MAR 29, 2016 Poured from a 12 oz bottle on 07.24.14. A: Strong smell of wheat. It also has lemon. A: 2 finger fluffy head. Cloudy straw yellow. T: Lemon and wheat dominate. Clove is subtle on the back end. P: Creamy smooth. Perfect. O: This is one of the best wits out there, hands down. I was looking forward to picking up Pliny on a trip, but this ended up outshining everything, including Pliny *gasp*. I was going to hoard some packs of this, but it was too good not to drink immediately. Its too bad that they dont distribute to my state. Oh well. It is a fantastic wit.

12 oz. bottle from Maplewood Liquors. Pours a hazy orange/ yellow with a thick fizzy head. Mild citrus clove aroma. Taste is malty but the back end is where the spices and dry tart citrus notes kick in. Bubbly mouth feel. Feels light, but still has substantial flavors. Very nice complexity for a wit. Goes down easy and will hold its own against any style.

UPDATED: JAN 31, 2015 Pours a light cloudy yellow with a think white head that leaves much lacing. The nose is spice with yeast. Body is fairly light. The mouthfeel is light with astringency and the spice is there with the yeast. The hops aftertaste lingers.
Bottle shared. Pours transparent gold. Aroma of cloves and hops. Tastes of cloves, bitter hops, and lots of wheat. Wheat aftertaste. Pretty good
Can you say cloves? Flavorful, but a style not for me. Bordering on offensive. Spiced beers are just wrong, far as Im concerned they belong next to the mulled cider.

Cloudy pale yellow body with thin white head. Earthy yeasty aromas with highlights of fresh citrus. Spicy cloves come out over the heavy doughiness with the initial taste. Finishes smooth with a tang of lemons.
Bottle. Cloudy gold with a huge head. Aroma is clove, spicy. Taste spicy with hints of citrus.

.33l bottle from Kavu. TNX mate.
Pours cloudy yellow with medium white head. Aroma is malts, wheat, hops, citrus and yeast. Flavor is mostly same. Nice beer indeed.
0,33l pullo Bostonista. Samea vaaleankeltainen. Tuoksussa hiivaa, humalaa, mallasta, vatsahappoa, vähän banaania. Maussa mallasta, hiivaa, humalaa, aavistus banaania. Ehkä ihan vähän sitrusta.

Bottle pours light golden, slightly cloudy with moderate head. Notes of lemon, spice, a bit of hops. Easy drinking, flavorful and nice finish. This offering did not disappoint. Recommended for a good, warm weather refreshing beer.

A classic. One of the first beers I got into to veer further into craft territory, and one I recommend to many others coming into it. Hazy, unfiltered on the pour with a creamy head. Lemon and fresh cut grass on the nose, with a tangy lemon curd feel on the backend.

12 fl. oz. bottle from DeLucas Market, Newbury St. Pours hazy yellow with a low head. Aroma is malts, wheat and plenty of lemon and coriander. Flavor is bitter malts, wheat, lemon, lemon zest, coriander and hops. Excellent witbier.

Slightly hazed yellow pour with creamy white head and lace. Aroma is medium wheat malt with a touch of coriander. Semi sweet start with a touch of pepper. Wheaty malt with a flat wheat finish and a medium/light bitter. A touch of floral hops and Belgian yeast. Medium bodied with aggressive carbonation. ok by me
Mellow, smooth, sweet. A crips wheat beer. A bit of yeast flavor. Light body and a little spice. Very sessionable.
"another of my favorite wits. refined and subtle with the spices and flavor, which is nice. refreshing, nice balance and refreshing. great for the style. pretty good overall. "

Aroma: wheat, yeast. Appearance: light, clear yellow, massive, creamy, white head. Taste: light sweet. Palate: initial malty sweets continue, some dry bitters coming up. Overall: decent Witbier, nicely balanced. Pint at Big Brew, Morristown.

Pours golden yellow with a foamy white head that lingers a while. Nose is all Belgian: farmyard cider notes, spice. Taste is balanced. Not too sweet. A bit thin for me. Slight citrusy finish. Very nice.

Tap @ burger.: murky gold with a nice white head. Rubber and yeast aroma with yeasty banana flavor. Thought it would be a little more mellow. Thick feel and tasty.
Drought. Pale yellow hazy appearance with large foamy white head, slight citrus aroma, low carbonation, bitterness of lemon peel, medium finish. Light and drinkable, I enjoyed it.

Draft. Cloudy, golden color with a hint of orange hue. Thick, frothy white head; substantial lacing. Wheat with citrus and coriander. Lingering, bitter wheat finish.

Poured from a 12 OZ bottle into a pint glass.
Aroma- Big citrus smell followed by some grains
Appearance- A cloudy soft yellow with a small white head. 
Taste- A well balanced fruit flavored brew with some hop and grass accents. very good.
Palate- Light bodied with a very smooth finish. A real pleasure to drink.
Overall- Top notch beer, very refreshing and with an excellent flavor
330ml on tap. Taste is yeast, star anise, light orange. Appearance is light cloudy with a nice white head. Taste is light sweet. Has a apricot after taste. Nice but not my favorite.

UPDATED: SEP 5, 2015 Nice spicy belgian witbier. I enjoyed a couple of bottles of these on the rooftop bar at stars, Charleston. Rerating 5 Sep 2015. First beer in the USA this trip. Bottle pour. Yeasty bready aroma witth coriander citrus, hazy pale straw. Creamy mouthfeel, high carbonation, subtle coriander and orange. Great witiber.

UPDATED: APR 18, 2015 100th beer rated. On tap. Pours a hazy golden blonde with a white head and amazing lacing. Looks great. aroma is bananas, cloves, a wheaty character with typical Belgian spice character. Flavor is crisp and refreshing. Bananas, wheat and a clean finish. Very good, this.
Pours a cloudy creme colored white. The nose is a bit spicy with a hint of fruit. Very smooth start and finish. An awesome Belgian White!
Clean, crisp, not rehopped like crazy as one would expect from a US version of a Wit. a bit watery and not quite as rich/velvety as the best Belgians, but good stuff (LH lounge, EWR)
The aroma is mostly spice and wheat. The taste is the same though I think the spice is a little too prominent for me. This is pretty good, but there are better Witbiers out there.

Minimal head, umami, long finish. This is my first rating here for my "beer outside of beer" experience. The long finish stands out for me. My beer palate is still fresh. This being my first rate I dont have a lot of comments on taste and aroma although I thought it had a somewhat neutral aroma. I enjoyed it with an Umami burger. The two went great.

Looking like typical white very cloudy bit of a bland colour, delivering a finger of creamy white head with lacing. Lots of herbal on nose, cilantro, wheat malt. Taste similar. Creamy mouth solid white. Its passible.

Purchased a single bottle on my trip to Maine. Pours a hazy golden colour with a long lasting, creamy white head. Yeasty Belgian Ale nose with mild orange. The taste has a little more bite, but the spices are still too light. Slightly creamy, wet mouthfeel. A nice refreshing witbier.

Pours a cloudy but bright straw yellow with a short white head settling down rapidly to a thin cap and minimal lacing. Nose is muted wheat, coriander, yeast, banana, and orange peel. Taste is predominantly light sweet wheat on the front end, finishing with a mild spice. Medium to full body and sustained slightly prickly carbonation, with a clean, off-dry, slightly tart finish.

Decent witbier, definitely a good one for a summer evening on the patio. I havent had the greatest of success with witbiers, making this one the best so far out of an admittedly mediocre lot.

Lane. 
W szkle zamglona, opalizująca żółć. Piana biała, obfita, drobnoziarnista, sztywna, bardzo trwała, oblepia szkło. Barwa: mocno zamglona, opalizująca żółć. Zapach słód pszeniczny, kwaskowatość, nuta belgijska, kolendra, cytrusy, skórka pomarańczy, lekka nuta drożdżować. W smaku słód pszeniczny, leciutki banan, stonowana kwaskowatość w stylu rozcieńczonego soku z cytryny, kolendra, skórka pomarańczowa, drożdżowa nuta belgijska, minimalna nuta przypraw, perfum. Goryczka niska.
Very fragrant banana smooth drink very light color with a small spice hint at the end.
Nice spicy, crisp, flavourful wit beer. Nice full body as well. If its available to you, get it.

Rating from memory. On tap at legal seafood in Massachusetts. Light gold with a frothy head. Sweet aroma of wheat, sugar, pumpkin spice, coriander, cloves, and yeast. Sweet wheat beer. One of the better witbeirs Ive ever had.
On tap Cloudy wheat yellow with a small half inch head! Banana aroma with a slight hint of yeast! Nice finish! Good stuff!

From the bottle. Very wheaty of course. That was by far the dominant flavor.

Sample @ Quintessence 2014. Bière blanche acidulé sans prétention particulière. Son nez est herbacé et légèrement épicé (coriandre curaçao?) peu amère avec des senteurs de levure. En bouche, les saveurs fluettes du froment sestompent assez vite en développant des arômes de banane terreuse. Blanche acide peu amère aux saveurs fluette avec une fin surette. Désaltérante sans plus.

Cerveza de color amarillo pálido con una espuma blanca que perdura.
Aroma a la levadura, naranja y cilantro.
Sabor a naranja y cilantro con un toque de trigo, es dulce.
Una cerveza fabulosa, muy bien hecha, parece una cerveza belga.
Bottle. Overall nice representative of its kind, the typical hints of banana. Spicy features.
Tap at Legal Seafood in Logan. Cloudy straw yellow. Nose is light cloves and banana. Light wheat, low on spice for the style. Nice and clean.

Fad: På restaurant i Sausalitto. Whats not to like. Lysegul uklar øl med et stort skumhoved. Tydelig belgisk wit med et amerikansk tvist. Let syrlig fra appelsinen. Dejlig frisk og ekstrem drikbar med masser af karakter.
Hazy yellow colour. Yeast, banana, coriander aroma, refreshing, a nice witbier
From Tap, sehr hell, fast klar, cremiger schaum, leicht säuerlich in der Nase, sehr frisch im Antrunk, vielfältige Aromen im Abgang

On tap at Side Bar in Wes Chester. Pours a hazy yellow with a thin white head. Nose is of banana, clove, and bready malts. Tons of aroma and taste for a Belgian White. A tad bitter with a full mouth feel but light body. Finish is nice and long.

UPDATED: SEP 12, 2014 Cloudy straw color, some lace but little and shortlived head. 
Light body, moderately flavorful, smooth texture, long palate, bitter, yeasty finish. 
Delicately bitter, off-dry, refreshing, never excessive acidity, 
Yeast, cloves, coriander flavors but not really resiny or citrusy, just a little fruity. 
Nice summer beverage, particularly when served cold, which I never do, at home.

The lightest beer I sampled to date.
Light straw in color. Very nicely carbonated but with almost no foamy head to speak off.
Traditional spice bill .
Traditional taste with overpowering spiciness.
Thin feeling in the mouth.
Too spicy for my likes.
Something my wife would get me after cutting the grass.
Draft at Julians, Providence. Pours a oudy and dull straw color, lots of white head. Nose crisp and citrus-forward, the way I like em. Body light and sylphic, slight tanginess. Just right.
Bottle at the Rookery. Pours a hazy golden with thin cream colored head. Aroma of yeast and lemons. Taste is a bit of spice, hops, and malts

12 fl. oz. bottle, bought somewhere in a small bar in northern Vermont, could be in Middlesex. Pale unclear yellow in the glass, white head. Hop and fruity honey on the nose. Starts hopy with yeast, malt and a fruity and spicy aftertaste. A little bit flatter to the end. Really nice one.
Better than my rating. Hazy yellow. Not much on the nose. Taste is lemon grain malt and hops all mild. All blended.

12oz bottle with no bottling date.



A: Pours pale yellow/off-white hazy with a fluffy white head.



A: Spicy yeast, banana, cloves, floral notes and herbal hops.



T: Burst of spices, cloves, coriander, floral hops, yeast, wheaty malt.



P: medium-bodied, smooth and creamy with decent carbonation.



O: One of the better witbiers Ive had; quite heavy-handed on the spices but thats to be expected of the style.

Its color was light yellow with a hazy body that produced a light white colored head. The head had a soapy appearance with large and small bubbles that hang out for a long time and make nice spotty lace on the glass. The aroma is full of wonderful malty wheat tones, yeast and spice. It has a bright vibrant flavor and smooth palate. It has a mostly sweet malt with some wheat tang and nice mild yeast flavor. Coriander and Curacao orange peel give it a good spicy and bitter/sweet citrus touch that works well with the very mild and slightly herbal hops. A smooth creamy texture, medium body and lively carbonation give it a very refreshing character.

On tap at Ledo. Pours a mild hazy straw yellow color with pure white head and measures nearly an inch thick, leaving a sheet of lacing. Aroma is wheat, grass, lemons, spice, malt. Flavor is heavily spiced, with coriander prominence. Residual lemon zest and floral notes. Lingering hop bitterness and saison-like characteristics. Light bodied and complex.

Yellowish appearance. Lots of lemon and spices on the nose. Super creamy mouthfeel. Taste is very smooth nice dry finish. Awesome

Appearance: light hazy yellow with almost no head and some lacing.

Aroma: minimal amount of citrus on the Jose but very light.

Taste: light spice with carbonation but overall a modest amount of flavor

12 oz. bottle. Hazy golden pour with a white head. Nose is banana bread, spice and lemon. Taste is fruity, with hints of orange banana and clove. Very refreshing, good American version of the style.

Une bière jaune, presque dorée et quasiment limpide, avec un film de mousse blanche. Au nez, agrumes, blé, paille, un peu de bananes même ; jusquà maintenant elle évoque un hybride wit/weizen. Facture plus classique en bouche, avec des agrumes encore une fois, et une sensation de rondeur dûe au blé. Une witbier classique, mais à peu près parfaite quant au respect du style.
Universally pleasing white beer. Much lighter than a hef and smoother than similar beers. Great summertime sipper.

12 oz bottle from notes. Pours a hazy but bright golden color with a medium sized creamy white head. The aroma and flavor have wheat malts, orange citrus, coriander and additional spices, yeast, floral notes, not the biggest beer but this strikes me as being good for the style.
Aroma is pleasant with citrus, taste is about the same, the carbonation takes over and dims the flavors slightly but the finish is nice.

Bottle. Aroma is sweet and wonderful, hard to place, with a little citrus. Whitest beer Ive ever seen. Its a very pale champagne yellow, with a fluffy white head that fades but doesnt completely go away. For the taste, at first its pure carbonation, but theres a softer, sweeter flavor behind it that is hard to place. I would prefer less carbonation and a little more hops, but the taste is simply wonderful. What a great beer.

The aroma is light citrus, lemon, cereal grains. The appearance is yellow/white,white head. The flavor is lemon, pepper, yeasty. Lots of carbonation. Big head. The knish is acidic, lemon. Medium in in body. Decent.

Aroma is yeasty, like wheat bread and lemon muffins. Appears cloudy yellow, thin white foam, some lace. Taste is lemony and sweet wheat with a mildly bitter citrus rind. Palate is fizzy and nice. Overall, good.
Bottle. Opaque gold. Lingering head. Faint banana nose. Refreshing yeast, banana, slight pineapple. Great warm weather beer.
Citrusy breast aroma. Cloudy yellow color with white head. Light floral citrus flavor. Bready wheat flavors hint of bitter and hops in the finish. True to whit beer style.

Bottle pour. Hazy light golden color. Hoppy spice aroma. Light body. Vert spicy for a white beer. Not bad, but different.

Appearance should be nine and palate ten. Good mouth feel, good finish, very yeasty, will drink again

Good aroma. Nice golden straw color. Taste: noticed a slight lemon aftertaste. That, combined with the high carbonation, made the brew taste almost like Alka Seltzer plus cold medicine. Overall, it had nice body, good potential, but could not get over that aftertaste. I am completely puzzled by its great reviews. Ill take Blanche de Chambly anyday.
Hazy super light yellow. Nice simple Belgian spice nose. Refreshing taste, easy to drink.

Hazy and yellow appearance, decent head and lacing.

Very aromatic smell with lots of spice and citrus.

Excellent taste, lots of orange and spice, some yeast in the background. Smooth finish, not bitter.

Great mouthfeel, not much carbonation.

This is a new favorite of mine and one that I will regularly request.

UPDATED: MAY 19, 2014 W aromacie klasycznie, choć nadzwyczaj intensywnie, cytrusy z przewagą pomarańczowej skórki, wraz z ogrzewaniem coraz silniejsza kolendra. Najlepszy wit jakiego piłem, sesyjne, a zarazem degustacyjne. Super!

Pale yellow colour, white head. Spicy aroma, cloves, lots of coriander, wheat, banana. Spicy flavour. Bit thin. Spicy witbier finish. Quite heavy on the coriander. Decent brew, albeit not very exciting.
(from 37.5cL(?) bottle @ Cantillon Quintessence)
Draft somewhere in New Hampshire. A nice witbier. Pours a cloudy yellow with lots of off-white head. Nose is citrus. Grapefruit and funkiness comes through in the taste.
Light hazy yellow body with low white head. Aroma is fruity, spicy notes, yeasty. Taste has spicy sweetness with light earthy bitterness. Body is full, flat carbonation.

Poured into a tulip glass the head breaks down quickly but has nice lacing. Nice banana yeast aroma. Very smooth with light carbonation. Nice wheat and yeast flavor make this a great example of a Belgian white.
At quintessence. Hazy golden colour with white head. Wheat, spices and citric aroma. Sweet, wheat and citric taste. Medium body.

@ Quintessence - Pale yellow color, with a decent white head. Aromas of banana, hints of orange, yeast and coriander. Creamy, smooth thick mouthfeel. Coriander, lemonade and banana, with bitter hints and a little pepper in the end, Very well balanced, refreshing, excellent Witbier, with a clean ending.
En fût à la brasserie. Blanche trouble. Épice. Très céréale. Citronnelle. Légèrement fruité. Citron. Florale. Coriandre. Sèche en finale.

At Cantillon Quintessence.
APPEARANCE: clouded white beer, small unstable white head.
NOSE: citrus, lemon, wheat.
TASTE: wheat, lemon, citrus.

12 oz bottle poured into a shaker. Aromas of baking spices are the initial impression picked up by the nose with some coriander, anise seed, and a touch of clove. This aroma is supported by a lemon muffin type of aroma. It pours a cloudy lemon yellow color with a light bubbly head. The head reduces down quickly to a light ring around the glass with no lacing. A muted, medium / medium - high level of sweetness, light bitter, and a touch of sour fruit hit the tongue. A notable amount of soft carbonation is immediately noticeable on this creamy beer. The moderate body finishes with a dry and crisp spiciness complemented by a light, sweet citrus. a bread and spice (cookie-like) flavor briefly linger in the aftertaste with a touch of caramel.

At quintessence 14

Bottle sample @Cantillon Quintessence 2014. Pours cloudy white with white head. Aroma spicy, fruity. Taste spicy, yeast, little fruity.

Bottle @ Quintessence. Hazy yellow colour, white foam. Well balanced white beer. Soft carbonation. Spicy aroma with notes of lemon and coriander. Light sourness with bitterness in the finish. Witbier is not my most favourite style but this is a good one.

Bottle at Quintessence 2014. Pours hazy whitish yellow with a steady white head. Nose is orange peel, coriandre and white pepper. Light body, a tad too sweet and a nice spicy taste. The wheat beers are not my favourite beers, but this one is the best U have tasted so far.

355 ml. bottle sampled @ Cantillon Quintessence 2014. Pale hazy citrus lemonade golden with a creamy white head. Nose is huge coriander, very thick with touch lactic sourness coming from the wheat, thick creamy wheat, touch banana and white bread. Taste is huge creamy coriander, thick milky wheat, touch sourness from the wheat, sweet banana, touch bitter hay in the back. Thick creamy wheat body. Quite reminiscent of Hoegaarden actually, this is basically a superior Hoegaarden, easy to drink, a job well done.
On tap at Pub Republic. Pours a hazy straw color with a bit of head. Nice mild citrus and spice.
2014.04 - Cantillon Quintessence 2014 - mooie kleur, troebel geel - neus/mond : witteke, beetje muf (het putje).

UPDATED: APR 29, 2014 Fra fad, Wythe Hotel, Brooklyn. Uklar, diset, gylden, store bobler i hvidt skumhovede. Dufter let krydret af gær, koriander, nedfalds-æbler, hvedebrød, citron. Vage banan-noter. Hvid peber. Svovl. Mild og lidt kedelig.

Usual go-to at a bar without a serious selection, Allagash White fulfills an important role as the standard bearer for a vital American brewery. 
Bitter-sweetness; rich farm flavors.
Tap at tap house Munich. Pale yellow, white cream. Lightly perfumed fruity notes, fresh, not starchy middle, well balanced fresh. Medium body, surprisingly chewy for a wit.

UPDATED: MAY 21, 2016 First ratingBottle at CBC Denver, April 10 2014.Cloudy yellow color, white head. Sweet, banana, spicy scent, phenolic. Sweet, metallic, phenolic taste. Flavor has some bitter lemon initially that gives way to a bit of nebulous spiciness and finishes with a mild, barely discernible, bitterness. The mouth feel is crisply effervescent and light. This is a pretty standard WIT--not great, but not bad.

From tap at Tap house Munich. Pours pale yellow with white head. Aroma has yeast, wheat, coriander, spices, orange. Taste is light sweet, light bitter, dry and crisp, banana, spices. Good refreshing wit beer.
Cloudy yellowish pour nice white head. Good aroma of lite citrus and spices. Crisp finish good Belgian white.
On draft. Orange peel aroma. Cloudy pale gold color. Tart and orange taste. Very refreshing after a long flight.
Nice version of a belgian white. Tasty, flavorful. Citrus, spice and the right amount of carbonation.

Reviewed from notes. Rcvd in trade.
The appearance had a hazy straw yellow color with a small fizzy head that doesnt last long, lacing speckles the sides of the glass.
The smell had some light citrus, clove and coriander.
The taste had some spiciness through the previously mentioned flavors with some added malty wheat, lemon and yeastiness.
The palate was about a light to medium, fairly drinkable leaving a peppery aftertaste and finish.
Overall, not a bad beer, but definitely one of the better Allagash beers Ive had.

12 oz bottle poured into weizen glass. Cloudy straw color with hardly any head. Smells of wheat, bit of coriander and orange peel, also smell bubblegum. The taste is light on the orange, heavy on the wheat. Nice light medium body and easy drinking. Simple not complex. Overall, decent.

Delicious crisp beer, poured with an enthusiastic white head with good lacing, spicy and fresh fruity scents but more polite than a Hefewizen -which i was happy of! Balanced taste of coriander, citrus and clove. Good mouthfeel with moderate body, some fizzy on tongue but finishes clean and dry. On draught at Bayside Bowl. Pours cloudy pale straw yellow. Nose is grains, orange zest, lemon, citrus. Taste is citrus, lemon, orange, wheat and grains. Finish is dry mildly bitter citrus, lemon, subtle peppery spice and cereal grain. A classic.
Yellow cloudy pour from tap at SIP. White head. Lemon and wheat taste. Decent wheat which is a style I don't really like
had this beer at the beer market in gurnee. Pretty good wheat beer. It went Excellent with my chicken sandwhich

On tap. Pours a cloudy straw gold with a white head and lacing. It has a bready aroma with some coriander and other spices. The flavor is spice and bread notes up front and a spicy, semi-dry finish.

A - pours hazy very light straw with soapy sticky lacing. S - aromas of Belgian yeast and doughy white bread up front. Floral and sweet simple sugars anoint with light overripe apples. M - light and very drinkable. Dry almost sticky end. Average carb. T - Belgian yeast BAM!!! Sweet doughy malts, candied orange and coriander abound. O - simple and nice drinkable Belgian. 3.1
Straw colored pour with abundant white head. Aroma of wheat, yeast, spice. Flavor is softer but more of the same.
One of Allagashs best beers. The orange peel is a bit on the heavy side and there is a ton of yeast, but its an aggressive white.
Pours a very hazy yellow. Aroma is strong with wheat and yeast with some citrus. Has a sweet citrus taste with some wheat, yeast, grass, and light spices. A grainy but smooth aftertaste.

Draft poured into a tulip at Matchbox Merrifield. Pours a hazy straw yellow with two fingers of off-white head. Aromas of citrus, funk, and yeast. The notes of citrus and funk are up front and well balanced. Tasting notes of grapefruit and lemon/lime citrus fruit and peel, funk, light wheat, light herbs/spices, yeast. Good lacing. Clear yellow pour, white fizzy head. Aroma - bananna, clove and spices. Taste - light spices, very crisp and refreshing, yeasty, with a bit of an odd aftertaste.
This beer is a bit bitter and the after taste is not good to me. The appearance is great!
Bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head. Loads of lemon, citrus, wheat twang, and spice. Mellow drinking with lemon leading the flavor bragade. Nice spritzy finish and decent body.

DATE TASTED: December 22, 2013... GLASSWARE: Konig-Pilsener weizen...OCCASION: Browns/Jets--a meaningless game? Not for a fan!... APPEARANCE: hazily unfiltered, tawny yellow body exhibits slow, steady carbonation; thin white head settles quickly; some tracings.. AROMA: lively lemon zest, allspice and honey greets the nostrils--more than pleasant, even (especially?) in winter... PALATE: soft as falling snow with a fizz that sounds the same; light and cleansing--highly drinkable; a satisfying, lingering aftertaste...TASTE: slightly malt; damp lemongrass with some intriguing spiciness--pepper and allspice--delicious; yeasty enough to hold attention and round complexity... OVERALL: I liked this so much, I gifted my wifes uncle with some for Christmas--and he agreed that this white is as formidable as weve encountered...
Tap. Cloudy yellow with a thin white head. Smells of spice, citrus, and yeast. Flavor is the same, on the sweeter side but with a balancing spiciness. Light bodied.

Bottle into pint glass, slight cloudy pale golden color with white head. Aroma of Belgian yeast (banana, clove), orange peel, wheat and faint spices. Taste adds notes of graininess, pepper, bready with some fruity hop bitterness. Light body, moderate carbonation, crisp with a sweet/faint spice finish. Tasty witbier.

ON tap at One World Lounge at LAX

Cloudy yellow orange color. Bright white one finger head. Good retention and left sticky web like lacing. 
Banana, orange, spice, and some bread. Nice and light but slightly rich. In a good way. 
High carbonation, light feel. Nice US made Belgian Wit.
Very nice wheat beer, pours nice with good looking brew. recommended by Peter King Mmqb.
At The Smith with my mom and Taylor. Cloudy orange. Aroma is thin, wheat, very light Belgium yeast. Taste is light smooth, fruity Belgium edge with wheat. Dry.

$3 for 12oz @ bottles in Spokane, WA.
Poured to NB Globe.

A: Pours a meringue yellow with a singe finger persistently white and fluffy head. Nearly neon yellow with excellent clarity until you pour yeast into glass. This then makes beer appropriately semi-translucent. Well done.

S: Crisp, seedy coriander. Cool, slightly earthy scent. Very spot on for the style. 

T: Mmmm. I dont normally like whites, but this, this is quaffable. Well done with appropriate grain flavors, nice banana, butter, coriander flavors can be found dancing here.

M: medium body with crispy, highly carbonated feel. Nice feel.

D: Good beer. Great representation of the style, particularly for an American brewery.

Serving type: bottle

01-29-2011

Appearance is true to style, a hazy, glowing white/yellow with a bit of white head on the top. Big slug of gritty yeast left over in the bottom of the bottle. The biggest hitter in the flavor is the Belgian yeast profile, a sweet mix of fruits with banana and orange most prominent. Sweet and tangy backing from the wheat. The spices show up most in the lingering mouthfeel. Its thin and yet a little harsh going down, not wowed by the mouthfeel at all. Overall good witbeer, easy to find.

FROM NOTES: October 21, 13.

A: Yeast, corriander, citrus (lemon), grassy hops.
A: Pours a hazy yellow that is very light and faded in color. A strong head that quickly recedes.
T: Citrus hops, lemons, spices, Belgian yeast, coriander, floral hops, fruity and bready malts, orages, pepper. More spice here than the nose.
P: Light-medium body; high carbonation; crisp and refreshing.
O: A nice Wit but perhaps a little strong in the spice department. Definitely one to try if youre at all a fan of the style.

Not bad but not sure of the spices. 
  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle: Bright medium gold. Cloudy. Light white head. Citrus and spice lift. Slight reductive note but very fresh. Clove or other brown spice. Loads of grain. Very dry. Slight sour note due to wheat. Low to medium bitterness. Lean, fresh, mid weight and length. Very elegant and pure. Would be wonderful on a hot summer afternoon. 
Perfect refreshment after a day of wine tasting!
The elegant dry palate reminds me of the Celis tasted many years ago. The more I taste it the better I like it.
All around nice beer. This is my favorite wit. Some clove, banana, pepper, light sweetness, and a nice soft palate and creamy mouthfeel.

Amazingly refreshing beer. Light fruity flavors with a hazy golden color. Solid mouthfeel. My favorite beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

HOE LORD! This is something SPECIAL. Id give this to my grandkiddies. Your heard me. you know it. its true. This is a bear for me and you. Even a lonely jew. And a muslim too. Beer is good. Beer is great. Beer may tell you your fate. Now listen you HOES and TRICK-NASTY-DADDIES we love it. We love it true. Now get on board, and follow through.

Had on tap at Max's in Baltimore. Pours a very hazy light yellow. Slight head. Aroma is wheaty and a bit floral. Nice. Flavor is slightly citrusy and lemony. A bit sweet light bodied. Finishes a bit sweet. Nice.
Light amber color, with cloudy pour from 12oz bottle. Little to no head persistence, slight lacing. Rather aromatic, with almost a floral taste. A Belgian, but simply so.

I poured a 12oz bottle into a tulip glass. It was bottled on 9/4/13 and cost $3.75 ($0.32 per ounce).

Appearance: Bright lemon skin-yellow hue. Opaque. Pours to a small, bright white, foamy head which mostly evaporates and leaves minor lacing on the glass. 

Smell: The smell of summer: bright orange and lemon citrus, light spices, clean flowers and Belgian yeast esters.

Taste: There isnt much to say about Allagash White that hasnt been said about a lot of other witbiers. Its one of the better American examples of the style as its tasty, robust, well-balanced and highly drinkable. This is exactly what I expect in a witbier. 

Just like the aroma, the flavor here is a sweet and spicy mixture of orange citrus and light peppery notes. A clean, refreshing taste across the tongue with hints of lemonade or orange juice, but without any tartness or acidic character. The finish imparts subtle clove or black pepper seasonings. Not much in the way of bitterness or specific hop character, though thats fine because this is exactly to the style specifications. Its satisfying to be sure, though I cant help but wish it was a little bit more robust.

Drinkability: Allagash White is so damn refreshing it almost seems to do it a disservice drinking it in colder weather. The mouthfeel is rather full and energetic for what is technically a smaller bodied beer. Refreshing and crisp with a clean aftertaste - its difficult to not quaff it all down at once. At only 5.1% ABV its tempting to throw back several of these in a row.
Nice aroma, decent head, pale cloudy yellow appearance. Nice sharp taste with light fizz. (K)
Wow the coriander is sharp with this one, great spicy flavors, nice Belgian flavors, great srudd

On tap. Hazy yellow pour with a white head. Clove, lavender, and dry clean malt in the aroma. Taste is round, heavy clove giving way to dry clean malt and minimal spice bitterness. Clean mouthfeel. Good.
Pale clear color with light body. Sweet flavors with fruity aromas and nice long finish.

Draft. Cloudy yellow. Reminds me of blue moon. Smells like orange from the wedge. Not bad

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Good spice, nice and light at 5% ABV....crisp and refreshing. Good sessionable beer.
Truly a damn fine beer. Pretty easy to find at least for an Allagash beer. Pleasant spice and nice wheat goodness. Lingers well and has a nice light body. Could drink this all day

Super hazy pale yellow with sediment floating around and a two finger white head. On the nose I get lots of Belgian yeast, coriander. The taste follows in suite, very crisp, pretty refreshing, but not really my favorite style. Allagash is great generally speaking though and this is probably one the best Witte beers.

On tap @ the Oyster Bar in Grand Central, NYC. Pours a very pretty hazy cloudy orange light orange color with a small head but a long lasting solid lace. good aroma of citrus (orange peel) and flowers, with hints of spices. Light bodied, with good carbonation. refreshing not very ambitious. A taste of coriander too. Abrupt palate with an alcoholic kick that kind of ruins the essence of the beer. good with seafood!
Tap at Gibbet Point Grill, the famed Peter King beer of choice, and its a slightly more spiced blue moon, nothing wrong with it, its delicious either to sip or gulp.

Keg. Pale yellow cloudy color. Fluffy white head. Aroma of coriander, wintergreen, and citrus. Lemon, orange, clove, and wintergreen flavors. Finish was clinging to the tongue, but medium body overall. Very nice witbier. Best Ive had so far.
Flaska. Dimmigt gul med vitt skum som snart sjunker ihop. Citron, örter och mynta i doften. Krispig citron och örter i smaken. Läskande.

Bottle. Cloudy yellow with a small white head. Nice aroma of wheat, some spiciness, flowers, some fruitiness and citrus peels. Wheaty flavor, yeasty, a bit sweetish, a bit tart, with citrus, a bit of fruity esters and a spicy finish. Medium-bodied. Quite enjoyable and refreshing.
Pours a cloudy yellow color with a spice aroma. Taste is a bit floral, but slightly acidic. A lighter beer, that is easy drinking and has subtle flavors. Kind of a floral taste, but light.

Draught @ Tryst, Washington, D.C. Pours cloudy pale yellow with small off-white head. Clear aroma of yeast and citrus. Estery and grainy flavour with notes of citrus and a subtle touch of banana. Bitter finish. OK but nothing really impressive.
very mild. decent flavor. Barely pale yellow in color with no head. Has no smell other than that of a plain old domestic beer. Tastes good. But nothing to rave about

Pours a clear golden color with large white head. Not a lot
To the nose, sweet malt and some spicy phenols. Flavor has a bit of spice character, mildly sweet, and almost a brett like character to the finish. Overall okay.
Great beer, like a good German heffeweisen. Great look, completely original, light and cloudy, with a small head that stays for awhile. The bitterness goes away after a few gulps.
Poured from a bottle. Cloudy yellow color, slight lived frothy heady white head. Sour yeasty smell. Light wheat and clove flavor with a slightly fizzy finish.
Quite nice, refreshing very wheaty and good foam too. NIce a little spicies aftertaste and smooth.
Bottle. Pours a pale yellow, big white head, good retention and lacing. Nose is coriander, clove. Mouth is medium bodied, cloves, hint of orange zest, dry wheaty-ness. Decent wheat.

UPDATED: NOV 26, 2013 Pours light golden with a light  head and lacing.  The lacing diminishes in a few minutes.   Light nose of Belgian yeast and spice.  Average carbonation. A superb spiced beer of the Belgian wit style. Very crisp with a burst of spice - coriander and orange. Excellent hop balance to compliment the spices. Crisp finish and light mouthfeel in accordance with the style. One of my personal favorites. Appearance is slightly cloudy, as it should be. If you like spiced beer, it gets no better than this.

One of my favorite beers. 2 finger head. Light and cloudy. Lemon at the front with a crispness that follows to the end. Wheaty all the way through. Perfect lighter beer for following a heavy boozy belgian trippel. 

This is what Budweiser executives think Budweiser tastes like
Draft sample. Cloudy pale gold with frothy white head. Yeast, banana, coriander, citrus. Light and crisp.

Pours an extremely cloudy golden colour with a frothy white head. Aroma is of coriander, cloves, banana and yeast. Taste is mildly sweet throughout, really nice. Light body, thin mouth feel, and softer carbonation. One of the best wheat beer i have ever had; amazing overall.
Decent witbier. Pours cloudy blonde with good head and lacing. Flavours of coriander, banana and some bread yeast. Finishes with light sourness and light sweetness. Soft carbonation. Tap at brewery.

Pours cloudy yellow with a tonsured head in white. Aroma is sweet grass, yeast and spice. Taste is bready with lemon, grass and spice. Maybe some banana. Slightly bitter finish. Crisp and carbonated. Pretty well-balanced. Burpworthy. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aroma of yeasty bread, coriander, and slight banana. Pours blond with nice white head. Taste is sweet like lemon, banana and yeast. Light in the mouth and easy to sip. Solid.

Bottle.
Lot 1903
Best by 10/13

One word to describe this beer: Gas.

Light and crisp mouth-feel. Weak yeasty lemon rind and nitrogen acidity with a piney and metallic bitterness up front. A weaker sweet finish of toast and honey-suckle with white peppercorn, and floral notes might save the beer from being a more complex Corona. The batch I had deserves no more than 80/100.

On tap at brewpub. An opaque yellowish-whitish with a short lived white head that did leave a very nice lacing. Aroma is peach, oranges, pears. Flavor is wheat, oranges, coriander, peach. Nice herbal shot, helps clean up the sugar. Light body, watery mouthfeel, weak carbonation.

On tap @ Barking Dog. Pours cloudy white golden with a 3 finger stark white head that lingers. Aroma is bready, tropical fruit, very yeasty. Slightly floral, slightly sour, easy drinking - this is what a wit should be.
The gold standard for wit beers. A perfect example of the style first popularized in Belgium, these guys do it best. Citrusy with a mellow wheat undertone and fairly dry finish.

Taster at the brewery, hazy yellow, white head with lots of lacing. Picked up wheat and lemon on the nose, bread and citrus in the palate... The coriander sneaks in and something else? Very nice...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours an almost radioactive looking gold with almost no head. Aroma is yeast, coriander and a hint of clove. Taste is a nice burst of citrus with a thin and crisp mouthfeel. This is a great refreshing beer.

Delicious beer with a yeast, coriander , lemon taste. Absolutely perfect for a warm night. Love this beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Wheaty, light banana, and some yeast in the nose. Light pear juice, with a smooth thin head. Initial has light fruit with some spice / flavors or peach and pineapple intensify / bittering and spice remain for a second. Thin-medium body. Nice, moderately flavorful wit. Very delicate flavors.

Pours hazy straw color. Nose is yeasty, wheat, spices, maybe some lemon. Taste is very light and refreshing. Wheat forward, with coriander, with a little spicy hop kick at the end. Very good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

4/13/13 bought from CBO and drank at Wasabi. 1st night with 50% menu. 
5/10/13 Had it at Landmark grill with Troy. Had it as beer 1&3 with a Sam Adams grumpy monk in between

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at the Mews Tavern, Wakefield RI. Now this is a fricken A+ representation of the style. Wow. LOVE THIS BREW. If the IBU was brought down like 2 or 3 BUs, this would simply be the perfect white!
Pours hazy lemonade color, wheat-forward malt, well-balanced lemony clove palate, finishing long with subtle hops.

Clear yellow with a small white head. Aroma is of yeast, coriander, orange and clove. Taste is about the same with lemony notes and slight bitterness. Thin to medium body. Drinkable and thirst quenching. Very good Belgian White with just the right amount of coriander and orange. One of my favorites.
On tap at the point, pours hazy yellow with nice head and lacing. Aroma is spice and bready malt. Taste is crisp and spicy, tasty.
