Opaque, dark lemon color, with head. Light flavor with lemon and a toasty finish. Medium-light body, medium-high carbonation. Refreshing and pretty decent wit.

0.355l bottle from Whole Foods Market Tribeca. Yeah, it looks like a wit in the glass with a really cloudy almost yellow straw golden body and a medium sized eventually fading to small bubbles white top. Nice nose. Really wit inviting with a really good amount of wheat and some coriander. Cloves is also present here, as is a soft citrus / lemon hint. Like what I smell. Also like what I taste. Its not overpowering in any directions. Balanced wheat with traces of both cloves, white pepper, coriander and more sour lemon. Really quenching and tasty. 20.06.2013
Pour is hazy yellow with white head and little lacing. Aroma of wheat, coriander, spices. Taste has lots of coriander, orange peel, yeast wheat, light acidity. Low body and medium carb. Good witbier!
Had a pint on tap at Fathers Office in L.A. Delicious, refreshing, spicy, very nice...

Very refreshing beer and warm day. There's not much to it, but the simplicity is nice. Good taste good aftertaste not much on the aroma or palate. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Bought in Freeport, Maine. Very good witbier. Pours a pale hazy golden colour with medium white head. Creamy in mouth. Aroma is wheat. Taste of spices, wheat.

Pint at the bistro, aroma is a little bread y and some spice, cloudy pour with nice head and lacing taste of pepper some citrus and general warmth from the alcohol at the end 

-- rated via 'Find A Beer' for Blackberry 10
2/5 because it is such a weak representation of a witbeer. Quite yeasty with minimal wheat flavor. Disappointing to lack such flavor/complexity because otherwise the body is medium and smooth.

Distinct color and refreshing flavor. Great for drinking in the hot summer months of Savannah. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aroma of citrus and orange, maybe even a slight earthy funk? Very full flavored. Taste maybe orange peel and coriander. Slightly sweet. A good full flavored white. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Excellent example of a witbier. Poured into tulip glass, appearance is pale gold, quite hazy. Beautiful, creamy, pure white head that lingers around. Lacing is remarkable. Aroma is toasty wheat, straw. Mouthfeel is creamy. Slightly spicy, wheat explosion, with perfect balance of light hops. Just a very hearty, complete Belgian white. Becoming my go to when I'm not enjoying an IPA or Pale ale.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours very pale, hazy, yellow with a thick white head that hangs around.

Smells spicy and citrusy

Tastes-Citrus and spice up front with some nice banana sweetness.

Palate- Smooth with slight carbonation.

Overall-Great witbier especially ona a hot day.

Sample at the brewery following the tour on 7/2/13. Hazy yellow pour with a medium white head. Aroma of sweet malt, banana, spice and pepper. Sweet malt and white pepper flavor with some clove before a spicy finish. Nice wit.

Strong pear and zest aroma. Beautiful cloudy light light golden color with champagne like head. Less pear and more apple zestiness at first taste. Almost has a cider feel. This beer is selling me on whites. Really fucking good. Will buy again.

Aroma: Nutmeg, allspice, floral hops, wheat, orange, well balanced
Appearance: Cloudy pale straw, initial large frothy head that falls to a small fine mousse-like head with great lacing.
Taste: Medium sweet grain/straw, banana, allspice, medium-high bitterness, dry finish, light pepper notes.
Palate: High carbonation, light body, creamy mouth-feel.
Overall: Very nice! I wish I had more of these!

350ml bottle, roused and poured. Freshly imported from USA. Thanks Mom and Dad!
Very refreshing throughout; tart flavor with mild spice notes and pineapple juice appearance.

UPDATED: JUL 17, 2014 12oz bottle in Hoegaarden tumbler. colour is a beautiful cloudy yellow wonderfully set for its style. small, but sticky white head that stays and leaves lots of lacing. baked bread aromas are dominating with spices and rubber elastic. im getting mostly a sharp lemon taste, with some coriander, orange peel and belgian yeast. refreshing and light on the palate, but not enough carbonation for me. one of the better wits ive had, a great taste for a great price on a beautiful sunny day.
January 2011. Bottle. Cloudy pale yellow with a white head. Aromas of wheat, spice and yeast. Flavors of spice, light fruit. Crisp finish.
On tap. Pours a cloudy yellow with thick white head. Well made but the low rating due to the style. Peppery and spicy beginning finishing dry.

On tap at Joe Canals West Deptford.
Appearance: The body is very cloudy, unable to be seen through, the color of straw. The head is white and creamy.
Aroma: Lemon is prominent with hints of banana, cloves, orange and sulfur. 
Taste: Very well balanced sip with lemon prominent and hints of orange backed by light spices and hay.
Palate: Creamy and highly carbonated.
Overall: This is a good witbier that is balanced nicely. Refreshing for the Summer.
Classic wheat beer. Slightly cloudy with aromas of banana. Flavor is banana with a hint of spice and wheat. Very refreshing on a hot summer day.
Draught at Simones Chi. Poured hazy yellow with light head. Light banana aroma. Quite smooth typical wheat taste.

An easy drinking Belgian style wheat great pairing with seafood tonight. Definitely again!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft. Pours opaque yellow with a frothy white head. Tastes creamy, with hints of lemon and malt. Smells bready and musky. Thick, heavy, and low carbonation.

Tap. Pours hazy yellow with fizzy, white head. Aroma is bananas, cloves, cereal and straw malts, light grassy notes, and faint bubblegum. Flavor is mostly bready malts with some light fruit esters, light hops, and faint toast; dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.
12oz bottle - pours cloudy pale yellow with white head and fancy lacing. Nose is wheat and lemon peel. Flavor adds spiciness. Sweet and mildly tart. Refreshing.

Light yellow, cloudy, lots of carbonation bubbles, slight head, nice lacing.  Aroma is wheat malt, floral hops, bit of bubble gum and fruity yeast. Taste is wheat malt, spicy and floral hops, lots of yeast esters; spicey and fruity.  Mouthfeel is light body, lot of carbonation, slight peppery spice. Overall very good American version of a Belgian Wit, easy drinking and tasty, I will buy this again.

Glass to bottle. Pours a hazy very blight golden, almost lemonade appearance, with a thin white head. Smells strongly of yeast, with a soft floral aroma, easy on the nose. Flavor is full of light wheat, with mild sweetness, spice, and hints of clove. Mild sweetness lingers into finish. Light body with a slightly oily feel, with mild sweetness lingering into finish. Quite tasty.

Bottle to a snifter.  Pours a yellow lemonade like color with A white head. Aroma is lemon, citrus and yeast. Flavor is similar with a little spice with some sweetness.  Light to medium mouthfeel with some carbonation.  Easy drinking and refreshing.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Somewhat middle of the road wit.  Two bottles worth:  somewhat lemony but, for my tastes, I might prefer more spiciness.  Others enjoyed it at same tasting.

Tap at Plan B, Springfield, 19/05/13.
Clouded pale yellow with a thin white head which clears to a film.
Nose is a little thin, grass, corriander, lemon, spice.
Taste comprises lemon rind, wheat, grain, corriander, light cereal, pinch of spice, touch of sugar.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, tangy citrus zest in the finish.
Ok wit.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
Allagash White on tap at the Poe House (NC)
3.5 2.9 3.8 4 3.75
Hazy yellow with small, partially durable, white head some sticky lacing
Aroma: Mild, yeasty, light, mostly citrus, fruity; hint of banana; light biscuits
Taste: Mildly tart and very fruity, with banana
Medium-light body; not at all waterly; lightly crisp carbonation
O: very pleasant and refreshing brew; excellent on a hot day.

Poured from a growler.  Cloudy straw yellow pour with thick foamy head.  Belgian yeast in the aroma and taste along with some coriander and orange peel.  Well carbonated; a bit of a foamy mouthfeel.  A nice refreshing beer for a summer day.
Cloudy light gold/yellow with bubbly, white head.  Citrusy aroma.  Taste is citrus, mostly lemon with hints of orange peel.  Smooth and dry finish.

On tap at Village Tavern in North Wales, PA. I've had a handful of great Allagash brews before this one, and they all make this one seem a bit like Allagash Lite. Not bad, but I prefer their other brews to this.

On tap at Toronado. Pours a cloudy yellow color. Tastes a bit tangy. Good quality white. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Very smooth with a nice balance of spices in the flavor profile. One of the rare instances where the Belgians are outdone in one of their styles by an American.

Bottle sampled in Exira, IA. Thanks to adnielsen for sharing. Pours a hazy golden color with white head. Yeasty, spicy, wheat flavors. I really like this beer, but this might be a touch old, still good.
Blonde voilée, peu mousseuse. Nez de poire et de gingembre. Un peu citronnée, avec de la pomme verte, du miel et du gingembre en bouche. Un bon rafraîchissement.

18 Jan 2013: Alfies on 9th Ave, New York. Pint from the tap, my first ever beer from Maine (I think). Chalkboard claimed 5.2% ABV.

Cloudy, yellow with a fading white head. Typical for the style.

Sweeter than I expected: however what do I know about American brewed Witbiers (not a lot really)?

The nose was all wheat and corriander with both orange and lemon traces too. These carried on into the taste with the sweeter orange hints along with the wheat taking centre stage.

OK more that great, but a pleasant refreshing beer that went down rather well.

UPDATED: FEB 13, 2015 A cloudy lemon yellow color with a bright white head of almost two fingers of head that leaves good lacing.  Refreshing aroma of lemon and orange zest with a little funk and spiciness. Taste is very pleasant with the lemon and orange peel. The Belgian yeast provides some funk and spiciness but also a bit of cracker in the aftertaste.   Has a hint of tang from the wheat and some sugar cookie sweetness.  Mouthfeel is silky and medium bodied with medium/high carbonation and finishes semi dry.  An exceptional beer that hits every sweet spot for me.  Has a bit of sweetness but finishes dry and has a nice fruitiness and the Belgian yeast flavor that I love.  So well integrated and highly drinkable.  A favorite.
Very crisp and tasty love it. Went to vegas and they dont have it had to take my own.

On tap at Toronado. Pour is hazy yellow with a fluffy white head and great lacing. Wheaty, clovey, fruity, biscuity, straw, light banana, and citrusy aroma. Taste is bright, wheaty, light pepper, biscuit, fruity, grassy, straw, and light banana. Medium body with high carbonation. Ok witbier.

12oz bottle. Pours a cloudy straw yellow with a thin white head that quickly dissipates. Aroma is yeasty, with notes of banana, clove, and coriander. Tastes of grain, banana, clove, cinnamon, coriander, nutmeg, and light citrus.
Really good summer beer. Fruity but wheaty. Not too hoppy. Very refreshing and crisp.
12oz bottle pours a bit hazy yellow with froth white head. Fruit and spice aroma. Lemon and apple taste.

At Avas in Easton from the bottle. Pours lemonade color with small head in a pint glass. Lemony yeasty spice aroma. Flavor follows exactly with a nice citrus and spice balance. Medium sweetness almost like some honey. Light easy drinking mouthfeel. Solid carbonation. One of my favorite whites for sure.

Une petite bouteille partagée avec Patrick. Bière blonde dorée ou jaune blé avec une mousse blanche. Le nez est acide, lactique à la limite avec des épices de bière blanche. En bouche nous sommes dans le même registre avec de la levure, de la coriandre et cette touche lactique agréable. La finale se termine, bien écrit, sur une touche un peu épicée. Facile. Version à 5,1%
On draught at Gestalt in San Francisco.  Yellow-orange with almost no head.  Looks like Hoegaarden, and tastes a bit like it.  Smells like a typical wit.  Fairly good, but a little bit plain.

On tap at The Pour House. Cloudy yellow pour, frothy white head, and lacing that coats the glass like adhesive. Aroma is Belgian yeast, spice, and cloves. Mellow taste with Belgian yeast, clove, light citrus, and a hint of banana bread. Soft carbonation with a smooth finish.
Actually had to go to the opposite coast that this is from to try this one while in California for work.  Decent wit.

Une bière jaunâtre et sa mousse blanche qui résiste un bon moment.  Un nez de blé tendre avec un caractère funky bien agréable.  Des épices et une légère touche fruitée.  Jaime beaucoup ce dosage méticuleux.  Les papilles sont aussitôt ravies par des céréales de blé mordantes.  Il y a une touche lactique qui rend lappareil bien agréable.  Les épices chatouillent les papilles tandis quun voile de notes citronnées se dépose sur mon palais.  En bouche, le liquide présente un corps frais et bien aéré par les bulles.  La finale est un régal dépices et de choses asséchantes.  En ce qui me concerne, cette blanche est une réussite.

Draft at Cedar Point. Pours a murky yellow with fluffy white head and lace.  Nose of sweet hay, wheat, spicy yeast, citrus and floral hops. I dont love witbiers but this is the one I judge all others by.  Great refreshing summer beer.
Bottle at The Porter Beer Bar. Pours hazy medium yellow. Aroma is faintly lemony. Taste is yeasty lemon peel. Dry finish.

Bottle (330 ml). Clear yellow with a small white head. Aroma is of yeast, coriander, orange and clove. Taste is about the same with lemony notes and slight bitterness. Thin to medium body. Slightly dry. Drinkable and thirst quenching. Good Belgian White with just the right amount of coriander and orange.

A - Pours a cloudy pale straw. Thick white head with excellent retention.

S - Lemon citrus, Belgian yeast, coriander, grassy wheat.

T - Sharp citrus bite. Tangy Belgian yeast. Spicy coriander and clove. Lots of wheat. Moderate carbonation with a slightly grainy mouthfeel. Finishes dry.

A very good wit. Lots of citrus fruits. Its crisp and refreshing. One of the best Ive had of this style.

Serving type: on-tap

10-03-2010

On tap at toronado. Hazy yellow, minimal head but some lacing. Bubblegum, citrus and spice (clove). Crisp and refreshing. Moderate carbonation, light body. Very pleasant, refreshing.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Nice and crisp beer. Light coriander aroma. Flavors of coriander and fruit. Pretty good but not as powerful as I?d have liked
Bottle to glass in Boston pub. Cloudy, unfiltered appearance. Slight aroma of coriander and an unidentified spice? Smooth taste, not to sweet. Great version of a Belgian wheat

Draft at lucky lab. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head that quickly dissipates. The aroma has a ton of funky yeast, lemon, orange peel, coriander. The taste is dry, citrus laden, and lightly sweet. Pretty good in the style.

On tap from Rattle and Hum NY. Pours with a nice thick heavy head which lasts fairly long. Thick lacing. Color is a pale dark yellow and very cloudy. Smell is pleasant with an earthy tone. Taste is also very pleasant with both hints of both wheat and citrus. As a slightly heavier beer it is filling but still maintains good drink-ability. Would definitely drink this beer again.

A perfect representation.  Whata solid white, citrusy, fruity deliciousness.  Not typically a wheat ber guy, but god damn it tastes good.  Light and mirky, white snow head.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This is the standard by which I measure all Belgians (yes, although it is brewed in Portland, Maine!). It has a cloudy, unfiltered look and a lemon-citrus, wheaty, banana and corriander taste.

UPDATED: FEB 19, 2013 Pours a hazy golden yellow on tap with a fluffy white head and light lacing. Aroma of Belgian yeast, citrus, spice, and wheat. Taste follows, with a clean finish. Slightly better than your typical Belgian wheat, but still a witbier.

Pour on tap, very hazy straw yellow pour with fluffy white head, aroma brought notes of nice white fruits, nice milky yeast, touch of grain, peach, pear, slight biscuit and bready notes, nice spice, finishing fairly fruity.  Taste is lots of spice, but nice mixes of white fruits with peach, touch of grass, nice floral notes mixing into yeast, nice biscuit and bread, finishing fairly bitter but slightly sweet.  Pretty nice.

Aroma is slightly musty, lemon peel, coriander spice and orange - subtle. Standard wit hazy yellow with a not very substantial white foam head. Tastes all up front at once - bitter musty orange and lemon. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Hazy yellow gold with a nice white head. Punchy, citrus and spice. Very smooth and lightly tart. Very refreshing.

Pours hazy pale banana peal yellow with a large white head. Smells of banana, hints of citrus and spice. Taste is sweet, banana, spices, and a hint of wheat. Medium-bodied bodied with a slick texture and fizzy mouth-carbonation, Allagash White finishes with a tang of banana sweetness.
Cloudy golden pour with flowery notes and citrus hints. Sweet taste and crisp easy finish. Great for the style
12 Oz. Bottle Hazy golden with little white head. Aroma is Fruit, spice and wheat. Crisp and sweet flavor of spice and fruit. Nice tasting refreshing beer with a little bitterness towards the end.

UPDATED: JUL 15, 2013 HAzy straw, lively carbonation. Drinks like a pop. Sweet, lots of flavor and refreshing. Great. Cant imagine much better for the styler. Great beer to introduce to non craft beer drinkers as well.

UPDATED: APR 27, 2013 Draft at Press Box.  Pours cloudy light yellow with foamy white head.  Aroma of citrus, wheat and slight spice. Taste is coriander, grains of paradise, citrus pith and rind and some grassy/floral notes. Very refreshing witbier.

En fût, au mondial de la bière de mtl, robe dorée opaque, arôme de levure, goût épicé d'orange.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Looks great. big foamy head with lots of sticky lacing, and a hazy body, which i actually prefer for the style, plus i pour aggressively so its going to happen if it is not filtered.
nose is decent, a lot of lemon is there, it has a slight astringency , with some clove notes also among many spices.
Coriander and lemon off the front, clove, wheat and yeast are working together and equally, creamy full body and low to moderate carbonation.

Solid, easily available and cheap.

Not typically a style I go for, but what the hell Ill give it a shot. 
Pours a clear golden straw color with a decent sized white head that quickly dissipates. Smells of lemon and pepper, a bit of spicy wheat, and a bit of yeasty esters. The flavor is light lemony wheaty yeasty and refreshing. Medium to thin body with a moderate level of carbonation and a  sweet slick mouthfeel. Nice light easy to drink beer that would make a great lawnmower ale.

A very wheaty beer. Very smooth with little aftertaste.  Similar to a boddingtons. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle: Aroma is fresh and fruity. Hazy pale yellow color, white head. Flavor is fresh and crispy, wheaty with notes of oranges and spices. Dry light bitter end.

pours slightly hazy pale gold.  nose is wheat, fruit (mainly banana and apple), spice.  taste is heavy on the wheat, with yeast, clove, and fruit (lemon, orange, and apple) in the background; banana seems to come through in the finish,  not my favorite style, but easy to drink.
Cloudy hazy pour with lots of lace.  A thin head gives off banana and cloves in the nose.  Taste is very mild with clove and banana.  Medium mouth with lots of carbonation.
From a12 oz bottle shared. Lemon nose. Notes of lemon grass  and coriander. Short bitter finish.

I could write paragraphs here, but I will simply state this- this is my favorite wheat beer, and probably my favorite go-to beer when I need something that easy drinking to pair with pretty much any food, or just a nice sipper that isnt too overpowering.  If you havent seek this one out, and be SURE to mix the yeast at the bottom into the beer like recommend on the bottle.  This is a perfectly balanced wheat beer, I havent found one thats done better yet...
UPDATED: DEC 16, 2012 Not too bad. Came highly recommended.  Light beer with some spicy taste.  Goes down smooth, bit much aftertaste.  Was expecting a bit more substance than what was presented.

The beer is mildly hazy and appears a straw yellow color. The head is pure white and measures nearly an inch thick, leaving a sheet of lacing in its wake.

The aroma offers wheat, grass, lemons, spice, malt. Appealing.

The flavor is heavily spiced, with coriander out front. Residual lemon zest and floral notes. Lingering hop bitterness. Pretty dry. Saison-like characteristics. Complex. The balance favors the spices a bit much for me, but this is consistent with the style, so no real complaints there.

Light bodied with ample carbonation. Zesty.

Overall, a solid beer and good example of the style. Another winner from Allagash.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 01-26-2012

Tap pours cloudy pale yellow with lasting white foam. The aroma is rich wheat with a light sweet Belgian fruity kick. The taste is rich wheat, very dense with a light pepper wheat spice but very smooth and drinkable. The amount of grain in this brew is filling, but also nicely bittered. Very nice and an excellent witbeer.

Great taste, aroma, color... The German purity laws were disregarded when they made this one. Its a great beer. I love it. Another one similar to this is " white rascal". Highly recommend anything from Allagash.
Pours cloudy yellow with a fluffy white head. Aroma is curious and wheat. Very easy drinking with a light finish.
Beautiful hazy yellow beer with fluffy white head and lace. Smells lightly of banana, clove and citrus fruitiness. Tastes of spices, citrus and yeast and mild sweetness. Solid white beer.

Pours a cloudy yellow with a big white top that leaves lots of lace. Aroma is a lot of cloves with a hint of some sweet banana ad citrus. Taste is yeast and clove up front with a nice combination of spices on the finish. Great wit!

Pours a bright gold with a 2 finger head that slowly fades. Aroma comes with some banana and floral notes. Taste banana, wheat, and moderately floral but also well balanced,  a hint of spice. This is a very refreshing beer. Would definitely get this again!
defiantly a white, drank from a frosted mug via a growler.  very aromatic, cloudy, little aftertaste

12 oz bottle poured into a pint glass. Pours a cloudy light yellow with a small white head. Aroma of citrus, specifically orange rinds, lemon and coriander, backed by malts, spices and a nice floral scent. Taste is a delicious citrus up front with a nice malt base and a slightly biscuity taste on the finish. Big on taste, but light and crisp on the palate. Very easy to drink.
Good aroma appearance was not all in impressed .initial taste was good but palate was bitter i thought

An enjoyable, drinkable witbier. Quite a bit of fizz to it but short-lived, some banana and definite yeast notes and the wheat prominent. Easy drinking, good session beer? Can picture sittin on the back porch in the rocking chair with this one.

Pours a hazy yellow with a thin white head. Aromas of lemon zest and belgian yeast. Flavor is packed with lemon and has a buttery back end. Im not the biggest fan of wheat beers but this one isnt that bad at all, just not really worth it for the price. Dont really understand why, at least in my area, these are only sold in 4 packs either.

This is probably the lightest beer I'll drink and despite its lightness, it's delicious. And even better with a wedge of lemon!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours a hazy pale golden color with very little head. A little citrus to the nose with some faint hints of spice underneath. Fairly light taste, though it has a bit of a bite to it. Would be great in the summer.

Draught @ Toronado, San Francisco.
Pours a beautiful hazy pale golden colour with a white head. Aroma of strong lemony notes, grass and some dough. Flavour of sweet orange, lemons, yeast, grassy hops, hay and floral notes. Light bodied, slick mouthfeel and soft carbonation. Really refreshing and a killer drinkability. An awesome witbier.

Bottle at family tasting. Pours a hazy straw/yellow color. Aroma is wheat with some spices mixed in. This beer tastes like a saison mixed with a wheat beer because of the spices, but it is very good. Not a style I like but overall a very beer.

On tap half pint at Gilly's Craft Beer & Wine in Rockville, MD. 

Cloudy, straw color with white head and excellent lacing. 

Aroma of lemon, yeast, spice and banana. 

Taste of yeast, caramel, lemon, spice and banana. 

Medium/light body and medium/high carbonation.

12oz bottle, thanks to mom. Hazy yellow orange color, some bubbles on the side of the glass. Thin white head leaves dots of lace. Soft, crisp carbonation, lighter body, clean finish. Nice zesty sweet taste, good spice notes. Good yeasty blegian light spicy aromas. Coriander, orange peel. Light lemon. Good belgian wit.

Bottle poured into pint. 

A: Pours a cloudy gold with a 1 finger pearl head.

S: Very yeasty on the nose with a nice subtle spice. Cloves and light cinnamon are present.

T: nice wheat yeast throughout with a definite sweetness, almost bubblegum in nature. Sweet candies as well. 

M: Nice creamy texture. Medium bodied. Little carbonation

O: Very interesting and sweet wheat beer. The spices give it a very interesting kick not present in most wheat beers.

Pours hazy yewllow   aroma is belgian yeast, banana, and citrus   flavor is excellent   corriander citrus notes up front gives way to banana and then finishes spicy hops    excellent beer  could drink this one all day !

Poured form a 12 ounce bottle into a pint glass. Pours a nice yellow hazy color with a white head that lasts for a decent while. Aroma is of lemon/citrus, fruit, coriander, sweet malt. Flavor is a nice smooth sweet malt, esters, citrus and wheat. Body is moderate overall with decent carbonation. This is a nice smooth beer that I would drink again.

Purchased at a country store in town. Pours a clear light yellowish gold with a trim snowy white head. Smells delicately of spearmint, wheat bread, salad greens, with hints of coriander, yeast and citrus, but brief. Tastes predominately as it smells: spicy (coriander, lavender), wheat beer dregs, with a nice hop bite by mid-palate. A little more watery than I was expecting and the spiced notes fade into an afterthought of artificiality by swallow. Still, for under $10 for the 4pack its easy drinking and its not too bad.

Allagash White is a very simple beer definitely meant to session. Pale yellow and cloudy in color with a sweet and spicy aroma. Tasty banana and warm spices make a smooth taste for this unfiltered Belgian.

Color is a uniformly cloudy light golden yellow. Floral and citrusy aromas are calm and relaxing. Initial bite is nonexistent, lingers on the palate with a slight bitterness. Gentle notes of clove and citrus (thing lemon and orange, not pineapple). Finish is clean and warm.
cloudy light yellow. small head. nice belgian yeast. smooth and refreshing. very nice for the style.

Not my go-to style beer but a good product from a great place. I have a problem giving kudos to Belgian style brews from outside Belgian because I have been and they are just phenomenal there but this is a good job. Nice banana and vanilla hints present.

On tap at Kinsale, Boston MA on 7 April 2010. Noted at 5.2% but that could have just been a misprint on the beer list. Very surprised I hadnt rated this before. Cloudy straw yellow colour with a very white head. Some subtle spices in the aroma although difficult to identify exactly what. Maybe coriander. Also thought I picked up some vague grainy nuances. A little orangey citrus on the palate but its all rather understated. Maybe served a little cold but I found this rather unremarkable. Reminded me of weak orange squash. I know these guys can do Belgian well so this came as something of a disappointment.

Aggressive pour into Boulevard tulip leaves nice 3 finger white head on top of a cloudy straw colored beer.  I love when beers have this look.  Aroma is yeasty and spicy.  Very clean taste, starts out smooth with some nice malt and yeast notes, then the carbonation hits and its a bit of sweetness.  The finish is where the spice really hits.  This beer is very nice, a front porch summer beer in my mind.  I would probably buy this again if it was available locally but it wouldnt be a go-to.

Hazy pale yellow, thin yet rocky white head with banana bubble gum aroma; flava is wheat, alcohol, and spice;   palate is soft w/ slight fizz; finishes long and dry w/ nice spice and banana yeasty notes

Bottle @ home, courtesy of Lukaduke! Thanks! Pours a cloudy whitish yellow appearance with a delicate, lacey, fluffy pearl white head. Spicy, white pepper, coriander, orange peel, sweet unmalted wheat, somewhat herbal/floral, light potpourri aroma. Initially some ginger and white pepper followed by lemongrass, yeast, wheat, and mild coriander in the flavor. Super clean and fairly delicate, soft flavor. Some mild spiciness on the aftertaste but the spices are done well and are in check. Nothing too complex but it is one of the best Belgian Whites Ive ever had. It probably would be fun have a kegger with this shit. I can definitely see how most people would rate this around 3.5-3.8, but Im a wheat nerd and love when the spice and yeast elements arent overplayed.

Pours a hazy blonde color with a finger or two of sticky foam.  Aromas are less spicy then I remember, I used to drink this in college 10 years ago but had enough after feeling it was getting overly spiced back then. Wow what a beer, nice notes of earthy spice touches of citrus zest and a great yeast presence that delivers a solid refreshing flavor that is balanced very nicely.  No more bad talking the white, keep up the good work Allagash Im always willing to admit when Im wrong. Cheers.
Wow dont know how this got a 94...not a great beer at all...nothing good of special note.....
Cloudy and light yellow with a bit of lovely lacing.  Really tasty Wit with a tiny bit  of funk on the aroma and lots of coriander in the flavor.  It makes me happy.
The nose is strongly herbal with notes of coriander and citrus peel. Semi cloudy yellow with a white cap. Brilliant herbal and citrus notes. Light and crisp.

Very good quality wit.  Aroma is amazing, fresh spice yeasty.  Flavor his nice but a little to spicy for my liking.  The coriander really breaks through. 

Easy drinker and def a wit I could have a few of.  Another quality beer from Allagash.
Nothing to say that has not already been said.  One of the best, especially on tap.

Draft. Poured a cloudy lemonade color with a foamy white head. Probably the best take on the classic wheat beer that I have ever tried, though the style remains low on my list. This one has a citrus floral aroma. Taste brings out some yeasty esters. Banana. Clove. Maybe some green apple. Medium light body. Juicy but a nice dry finish at the end. Light bitterness seems to be more herbal/floral than spicy. Thyme. Lemongrass. Dandelions? Quite pleasant.

Pours big cloudy and golden. Small head that dissipated with very little lacing. Smell is big yeast, spice, coriander and oranges. Taste is similar, with a hint of ginger, and cinnamon.  Nice beer, a tad over spiced but I could have a few.

Bottle sample at my place, thanks tomer, pours yellow to lemon hazy with a medium head, aroma of lemon, honey, wheat, bubblegum and coriander, flavor of bubblegum, honey, wheat, coriander seeds and clove, medium bodied, decent

On tap in Frenchtown, NJ at the National Hotel. Murky yellow body with small head. Nose is citrus and fruits, apple and sour. Taste is apples and citrus quite tart. Creamier texture. Some wheat in there as well. Pretty good with spices in the finish.

bottle sample, thanks mom and dad, small stable head with small bubbles, hazy pale golden orange colour, aroma of mustard seeds, spiciness and some wood, orange and a hint of white fruits, grapefruity flavour with some pine wood. Pleasant and very refreshing.
Great cloudy yellow off tap.  Allagash never fails to impress.  I would definitely recommend.

Perfect Wit, Had at the tasting held with the brewery tour.  Pours a light gold with a big frothy white head.  Aroma is spicy, corriander, belgian yeast and wheat.  Taste is a plethora of tastes, spice, yeast, wheat, clove and corriander.  So nice, so good.

On draft in a large allagash tulip. Nice presentation for a refreshing Belgian white. Consider this an ideal one and done beer that pairs well with most summer meals. Nothing outstanding, just a solid offering and consistent..
bottle @ Jockey Club, Las Vegas. cloudy yellow, white head. rubbery aroma. citrus, wheat in the flavor.

35,5 cl bottle @ hotel room, Las Vegas
Aroma is slightly sour and stale with leathery apples. Also hints of sewer and a feeling of air that has been in a bike tire. Flavour is tart and slightly sour with yeast and wheat. Also hints of coriander and bun dough. The sourness does not fit here completely. Feels a bit better as the last sip goes.
240712. Bottle at hotel in Las Vegas. Pours hazy yellow with a small head. Aroma wheat with some rubbery feel. Traditional wit in the taste though. Low palated. Not Bad.

355 ml bottle @ Hotel room, Las Vegas.
Pours hazy pale golden color with medium head. Aroma of wheat, yeast, mild spices, herbs, soap, lemon and some grass. Flavor of lemon, spices, herbs, yeast and hay. Too stuffy.
3434

500th rating!!!  Meant it to be for a Calif beer while on vacation but...  Worked out great looooved this beer. Bottle to glass aroma was of fruits banana and I got pineapple cream???  Light wheat pour. Taste was crisp With light sweetness light if any bitterness undertone of spices. Extremely well balanced. Glad this was 500. Now Need more
Lighter and more drinkable than many overly-creamy Belgian whites.  On the other hand, there isnt much unique or special about it, either.
Not a beer pro but the aroma color and flavor are unique very yummy beer mmm..:) on tap or bottled 4 pack any kind of pour is great.
Tap.   Fresh lemon grass and wheat,   light spice.  Cream.   Dry .   Lady squeezed a lemon init which was fine.   All this took place at redbones.   Cadell. Evans attacks just arent panning out :(
Bottle: Aroma is fresh and fruity. Hazy pale yellow color, white head. Flavor is fresh and crispy, wheaty with notes of oranges and spices. Dry light bitter end.

Pours a clear golden with frothy white head.  Aroma is very yeasty, with undertones of spice and banana.  Taste is not quite as yeasty, but still exists.  Much more banana, with orange and wheat as well.  Lighter body and quite crisp.  Good for a hot day or if you want to drink many of them.

Not normally a wheat fan but this one is very delicious. Banana and yeast on the nose. Spicy - coriander, bitter, refreshing. Cloudy white color.

Aroma is slightly musty/sweaty wheat malts, spices and citrus.  The flavor is spices, wheat, citrus, fruit and a malty/fruit finish.

Enjoyed on tap at Coopers in Chicago, IL while eating dinner with my former groomsmen before we went to see something called Predator: The Musical, which sounds better than it actually was.  Happy to have tried this one and have been meaning to for a while.  Appearance is a vibrant gold with a prominent white head.  Aroma is like a quintessential wit, light citrus/hay notes with an undertone of spice.  Taste encompasses most of the aroma elements and it finishes rather dry, which is great for a brew like this.  Would gladly have this again.

Great summer wheat beer, notes of citrus with undertones of yeast. Good choice for hot summer days

Yeast smell, a little bit strong. smooth and light. Fruity and enjoyable. Pleasant white color.

Tap at Monks Cafe. Bright hazy yellow pour with a fluffy white head. Awesome clove and citrus. Terrific.
a good all-around white.  slight spice and a bit of citrus flavors.  light yet flavorful.

Bottle. Hazy straw golden. Wheaty, coriander, spicy, malts. Light medium body, taste doesnt sustain. Drinkability is high.
thin to medium off-white head, cloudy light golden color, notes of wheat and fruit on the nose.. nice light wheat flavor... refreshing drink on a summer day!

On tap. Pours cloudy light yellow/white with a large-ish white head. Aroma is light wheat with some coriander. Flavor is medium-bodied wheat malt, with some coriander and zest, and a somewhat spicy finish. Nice wit interpretation.

Pours a light ochre with tall foamy head. Aroma has notes of biscuit and yeast with some spice. Flavour is subdued with biscuity malt and wheat.

Pours a pale, hazy white. A little sweet up front, then fades to some spiciness.
Pours yellow with a foamy 1/2" head.  Aroma of wheat, lemon, cloves, yeast.  Nice taste that mirrors the aroma with a light to medium body.

One of the best domestic interpretations of an authentic Belgian wit!!! Appearance: cloudy hazy straw

On tap.  Cloudy pale with creamy white head that left a nice lacing in the glass. Aroma is yeast, citrus, coriander, sweet fruity.  Taste is fruity start, wheat, citrus, spices.  Nice.

Pours a hazy lemon yellow with a creamy medium white head...great retention and lacing.  Aroma has nuce subtle spice and citrus.  Flavor is more on the spicy side...coriander...some mild wheatiness...good spicy bitterness.  Mouthfeel is light/medium with a dry spicy finish almost like a saison.

Aroma: Yeasty, lemon zest, a rather weak smell of varied spices as well.

This super delicious. Very light and drinkable. Creamy white head that lingers, good lacing. Spicy, lemony aroma. Yeasty, lemon. Quality all the way through. Leaves you wanting more.
Pours a pale yellow with a white head. Aroma is fairly citrusy. Taste is similar to the aroma. Its pretty light. Good flavor in the front. Not bad but not spectacular in my opinion.
Pours a hazy yellow color with a small white head. Aroma is corriander and cloves. Taste has notes of orange peele, and cloves. Very easy drinking and light bodied.

A draft pour at The Local Beer Bar in Eureka, CA.  Nose of wheat,  light lemon, and yeast. Medium in body and light and refreshing mouthfeel. The flavor is lemon, yeast, and spices. Finishes dry and lightly bitter. Quite a refreshing beer.

Belle créature blonde, très pale surmonté dun collet douillet et délicat. Le nez appartient au clou de girofle et la présence de céréales. En bouche cest  croustillant avec un fini velouté amérisé par le clou de girofle et la noix de muscade. Saveur linéaire mais efficace.

Cloudy pale yellow. Creamy white head that lingers, good lacing. Spicey, lemon-y aroma. Yeasty, lemon, and very drinkable.

Nice refreshing version of a wit. Cloudy yellow. Citrusy and sweet aroma. Taste follows suit. Little carbonation. Very drinkable and refreshing for a warm Spring day.

Color:Yellow cloudy
Aroma:Citrus, hint of yeast, coriander
Body:Orange, black pepper in the middle, light sweetness
Finish:Light bitter finish
Over-all/Mouth-feel: Light and crispy. Great summer beer. Low carbonation.

A: Pours an extremely cloudy yellow color, with some suspended yeast appearing in the body. Not much of the white-colored head appears.

S: Phenols, coriander, citrus peel, wheat, and some yeast funk.

T: The flavor is a little hard to describe. Theres some opening tartness, hints of orange peel and black pepper on the middle, and an incredibly crisp, slightly bitter finish. Everything here is a little subdued and light, but the flavors work well anyways.

M: Doesnt have the strong carbonation typical of wits, but sweet zombie Jesus, is it refreshing. Also has a lighter body and a hint of wateriness on the back end.

O: Wow, this goes down easy. In fact, it goes down too easy...I could seriously down an entire 4-pack of this in one sitting. Not the most in your face beer on the market, but an awesome summertime drink.
Pours a hazy golden color with a small white head. Aroma is banana, bread, toast, and honey. Taste is very similar in nature. Thin bodied, but easy drinkability.

Aromas of coriander, orange, citrus and vanilla. Cloudy, pale golden yellow in color with a very thin foam top. Delicious flavors of vanilla, coriander, orange, citrus, lemon all topped off with a perfect carbonation. Fantastically balanced flavors and great drinkability. Overall, a truly well-done beer with genius flavoring. Id give this an A+ rating.

Hazy straw yellow with a nice two fingers of dense white foamy head. Aroma of spices and citrus, particularly nutmeg, cinnamon, and orange peel. Taste followed the nose perfectly with balanced hops and spices. Yeast is more promiment but under control.

Cloudy, pale yellow. Decent head with great retention and lacing. Smell was full of yeast, orange, and coriander. Taste was  a hint of orange, a little lemon, some coriander, even a touch of pepper with just a little bit of crisp hoppy finish.
Om tap at Thinking Man in Decatur, GA. Lemon yellow with a creamy white head. Creamy, yeasty taste. Full mouth. Belgian sweet.
Aroma has spice and some fruit, especially apple and lemon.  Sweet, spicy taste with a slightly bitter, citrus finish.  Really tasty, this might be the best white beer Ive had.

Mild citrus hops,  Medium to full bodied. Moderate, but soft carbonation. Medium bitter and mildly sweet. Creamy on the palate. Medium finish that is very mild. Well balanced beer.
