Pours yellow with thin white head.  Aroma is mild yeast and spices with a little citrus.  Taste is sweet malt, some clovey spice, and a little bit of orange peel.  Tasty and easy drinking.
Tap at Publick house.  Orange aroma, some slight spice.  Orange and sweet malt taste.  Not bad
Pours a pale gold color with a small white head. Aroma is corriander and cloves. Taste is the same plus a touch of pepper and orange peel. Light and refreshing. Easy drinking and enjoyable.

Draught. Body appeared almost the color of orange flesh - orange subdued by white cloudiness, with a half inch of white head that eventually subsided. Aroma was sweet orange peel, grass, coriander, a dash of pepper, and perhaps cloves. Flavor was sweet clove like malt, light orange peel, with a subdued sweetness toward the back, slightly herbal, grassy and citric. Palate was very soft and sensuous, carbonation just tickled the back of the throat, and afterards a light orange peel taste lingered.
12 oz bottle.  Very spicy flavor with orange and lemon overtones.  A very good belgian white.

Pours cloudy pale yellow with thin white head.  Aroma is of sweet wheat.  Refreshing.  A good wheat beer with a mildly bitter taste.  moderate carbonation.  I look forward to trying other allagash beers!

UPDATED: AUG 8, 2009 Smells very wheaty. Has a beautiful clear white straw yellow color. It has a spicy flavor, and then ends with a distinct bitterness. Ive enjoyed this delicious clear smooth white ale for years.
On draft at Teresas.  Poured cloudy gold with egg white head.  Lemon, orange, and coriander flavor.  Easy drinking.  Very enjoyable.

UPDATED: JAN 14, 2012 Classique Belgian white aux saveurs de citrus et de coriandre. Elle est très douce et légèrement piquante. Nest pas meilleure que la Hoegarden. 14-01-11: Blonde-Blanche, trouble avec peu de mousse et une légère effervescence. Aromes frais de critons, de coriandre et dépices. Ne change pas la cote, mais meilleure que la hoegarden, avec plus de complexité et de saveurs.

Snowy, hazy, wheaty. A film of bubbly constellation-like head.

Yeasty bread and lemons with sweet gooseberries on the nose.

So crisp and light. Plus cereals = RICE CRISPIES.  Melon and sweetgrapes meet lemon, biscuits and waffle cone.

Tingly and light, very refreshing.

A very pleasing white. Expertly put together.
decent white pours cloudy golden with a white head that fades. tastes of orange, corriander, and clove.  not a big white fan but this is decent

750ml caged and corked bottle (Batch #50) and served in a tulip.  Lightly hazy pale golden pour with a big, chunky head of off-white foam that slowly settled.  Very good lacing.  The aroma had bright lemon, oranges, coriander, and also some mild funk.  The flavor had lemon zest, honey, coriander, and some spicy yeast.  Very round, soft mouthfeel from the wheat.  Medium-bodied with moderate carbonation.  I woudl have prefered it to be a little more crisp.  I have had this on tap also, but this bottle-conditioned 750 was much better.  Pretty nice for a wit.

12 oz twist off bottle as show in the picture. Pours with a small white head over a confusingly clear gold body for a wit. Looks filtered and does not seem bottle condition in this 12 oz. Aroma is quite nice though with coriander, bread, honey and flowers. Taste is honey, flower blossoms, bread, coriander and orange peel. Thin and somewhat water like mouthfeel.
Bottle. Pours a piss yellow with a white head. Aroma of cinnamon, clove, vanilla, wheat. Nice spicy wit. Cinnamon, clove, vnailla and wheat taste, a nice spicy wit.

Draft.  Pours a hazy yellow with a rocky, white head.  Yeasty citrus, primarily lemon, and a bit of biscuit in the nose.  Medium carbonation with a light, slightly dry mouthfeel.  Yeast, coriander, and lemon make up an otherwise unremarkable palate.  Unfortunately this one lacks much in the way of depth and is pretty ho-hum.  Crisp, clean finish.  Highly sessionable and good for a summer day.
desde portland maine hasta wine-o con ghawener, guayo palomo, neto , rickt, juanca barrientos y estuvo buena.  no tan fermentada y mas suave pero no son mi tipo

Bottle: Drank at a beer tasting event in Wine-O. Has a nice soft fruity flavor, lots of malt and light traces of spices (cloves). Overall a nice event especially with Guayo´s family anecdotes! Should become a regular event.

750ml bottle - Batch 51 - This bottle has been sitting in my cellar for a month or two, and Ive always found something Ive wanted to drink more. Finally pulled it out to share with the wife, as the weather is getting a little nicer. Pours hazy golden amber with a big frothy head. Nose is all oranges with a bit of spice and yeast. Yum. Flavor is oranges, wheat, and nutmeg. Theres a hot, spicy finish that almost comes off as hoppy. A little harsh carbonation, but overall not a bad beer for drinking out on the porch on a sunny day.
Good taste, that was too quick to leave the palate.  Nice head out of the bottle.  Good aroma.  Not a bad American version of a belgian wit.

Pale peach flesh goldenrod color with an off white head. Hazy body and okay retention/lacing. Aroma is wheaty with a lot of banana pith and a kiss of coriander. Flavor is again laden with banana pith, but theres more complexity than in the aroma. Coriander is still there but its joined by a light lemony tartness and some citrus zest. Slightly sweet doughiness paired with the citrus evokes lemon bar pastries (although not nearly as sharp or sweet). Body is thin enough to be refreshing but not too flimsy to carry the flavor. Carbonation is just a touch high, but its soft enough to avoid being distracting. Overall this is a very good witbier but it lacks the depth and variety of ester notes of the best Belgian examples.
Draft at Flying Saucer in Ft. Worth. Pours hazy golden with whtie head. Aroma is citrus, wheat and light yeast. Flavor is light and crisp with citrus, yeast,  and light spices. Pretty good wit.
Hazy gold with thick white head. Aroma was citrus,hops and a bit sour. Flavor was the same with a floral aftertaste and spice.

Cloudy pale gold with a two finger white head. Fair amount of lacings. Aroma of floral hops and grass. Taste is mild bready, grass, wild yeast, with a mildly bitter hop flavor. Very smooth drinker and quite sessionable. The hickory or boiled ham notes are minimal which made this a pleasant beer for me.

750ml bottle from Ryans Party Store In Port Huron
Pours a pale cloudy orangy yellow with a small white head
The aroma is yeast spice and citrus
The taste is belgian yeast sweet spices lots of carbination
Pretty good but kind of expensive

Draft at Good Night Irenes  Pours a pale yellow with a thin white head.  The head dissapates rather quickly.  Aroma of good citrus flavors.  Has a malty flavor.  Decent mouthfeel and pretty good carbination.  This is a tasty beer but not totally outstanding.
Great Maine beer with all of the lovely crispness of a true wheat beer.  Allagash achieves a superb pale and cloudy appearance with a nice citrus flavor.

An old favorite of mine.  Pours a very pale straw yellow color with lots of crap floating around.  Thin layer of white bubbles on top.  Very intense aroma dominated by yeast.  Lots of citrus, orange peel, and coriander.  Grainy malt flavor with strong yeast flavor on top.  Spicy and citrusy.  Very crisp, refreshing and easy to drink.
This is an excellent white beer. Smells of citrus and spice which is expected. Cloudy golden yellow with a hint of orange. Best served cold and goes down nice nad easy on a hot summer day.
Aroma of banana, citrus and spices.  cloudy, gold-yellow color with foamy white head and good lacing.  Flavor is light and refreshing, little bit of citrus bite in the finish.  Very solid beer.

Incredibly refreshing.  I love a good, unfiltered Belgian White, and this is one of them.  A beautiful, cloudy pour, it sports a thick, white head.  The aroma is there, but you practically have to get your nose in the head to smell it.  Fruit notes are obvious.  Spices come through on the finish.  A beer you can drink all night, one after the other.
Solid witbier. Lots of yeast aroma to this one with a flavor that follows suit. Hints of spice shine through on the finish. Pretty refreshing as well.

Draft at Hulmeville Inn.  Nice cloudy pour with dense white head typical of the style.  Flavor was a balance of a lot of yeast with a modest malt profile.  Some hints of coriander at the very end.  Aroma was subtle spice and Belgian yeast.

Location: Had this one a few times, originally rated after drinking at the Yard House in Lakewood, CO.  July 08


Overall Impression: 
Pretty decent beer for this style, its pretty well made, lots of citrus to it.
Very cloudy light yellow pour. Aroma is clove and citrus. Flavor, light wheat with lots of citrus, some spice and orange peel. Pretty sold white.

UPDATED: JUN 17, 2011 Clouded lemon pour. Weak smell. Tastes of citrus wheat with a dry lemonhead finish. All in all very refreshing. 4.0
RE-RATE 6/18/2011 Bottle from Central Market. 
This beer is bottle carbonated which means it was packaged with yeast, which still remain at the bottom. Often time I will pour out the yeast but the label on this beer gave strict instructions to include the yeast with the beer so in it went! This gave the beer a naturally cloudy appearance with a light golden color. There is a fair white head on it that lingers for just a bit before fading.

There is a mix of yeasty notes and spice on the nose. The yeast gives it a light bready feel that is paired well with sharp fruit and the spice is a clove-esque type smell.

The flavor is more spice and clove than sweet fruit and has a bitter finish that goes through to the end. If there was a bit more sweetness and fruit it would make this beer superb.
Taste 3/1 Bottle. Looks: Nice cloudy yellow/gold. Aroma: Spicy, lemon, clove and orange peel. Taste: One of the better whites Ive had. Fresh, cohesive and very drinkable.
On tap at the Flying Saucer. Cloudy golden yellow in color with a decent sized white head. Aroma is of banana, clove, coriander, pepper, and herbs. Taste is of banana, lemon, yeast and spices.

Enjoyed via bottle.  Initial appearance is slightly cloudy, with a full white head of foam.  Aroma is one of spices, coriander, and citrus.  Folds lightly over the palate, with a spritzy, dry finish.  An excellent example of the style from an excellent brewery.

12 oz bottle.  Pours cloudy yellow with a small head.  Smells of sweet fruit and sugar, almost like Trix cereal.  Tastes about the same as the smell.  Nice wheat flavor, plenty of fruit sweetness, almost artificiallly sweet.  Some spices are lightly present.  Fruit flavors are of white grape, apple, pear, and apricot.

Imperial pint draft poured on tap at the FFF brewpub (.Munster, IN). Pours a hazy dull straw with big billowy white head, well hazed, with a nice lacing. Aromas are typical witbier, nice wheaty aroma with estery orange peel and light coriander. This is really shaping up to be THE witbier. Initial is light on the palate, but medium bodied, nice wheaty body with light spice, orange peel, and coriander. Finishes light, flavored, but refreshing. Light, not the best wit, but pretty good. Finishes smooth with lingering flavors.

On tap at the Flying Saucer in Ft. Worth.  The look is cloudy, golden in color, ok white lacing head.  The smell is wheat, citrus, wheat, lemon, spices, honey, banana, and coorinador.  The taste is good, spices, yeast, fruits, and wheat.
poured cloudy yellow with a white head. aroma, yeast, citrus, orange and lemon, wheat. flavor, banana wheat, orange, spices
Draft. Lightly hazy light yellow color. Large white head. Strong spice aroma. Spicy, citric, slightly bitter, yeasty flavor. Medium-to-light bodied. Refreshing.

Bottle.  Pours a hazy yellow color that for some reason reminds me of lemon drop candies.  Yeast particulates in suspension. Medium sized white head.  Sweet citrus, wheat,  coriander on the nose.  Body is light and clean.  Finish is crisp as well with light citrus and yeast notes.
Cloudy golden yellow color with a thin white head. Skunky aroma with a hint of yeast. MIld wheat flavor with a lot of spice.

For a wheat, this has a lot going on- flavors not common to beer. That being said, I would rather drink a beer that tastes like beer. Taste of orange peel and coriander is strongest. Lots of spices. I had it with Mahi Mahi, which seemed to negate the flavor of the fish. Save it for deviled eggs or other spicy appetizers.$7.99 for a large bottle, maybe 25 oz at Gulf Liquors Miami Beach.

Pours a slightly cloudy straw gold with a tall rocky white head that has good retention and leaves really nice lacing. Aroma is big on wheat, spice, yeast, fresh orange peel, green banana, not the most comlex but very inviting. Flavor is chewy wheat cereal, orange, coriander, sweet floral notes, more green banana. FInish is yeast and spices, with a sort of tart green banana and orange note that I though was interesting but not the most tasty. Body was a little sweet and almost slimy. I really think it is a pretty good beer though, it really tastes better at a warmer temperature than I would normally drink a wit.
Bottle. Bright yellow color with a thick creamy white head. Strong smell of spices. and wheat. This was a very light and refreshing brew.

(bottle - 12 oz) Cloudy yellow pour with a fizzy but lasting white head. Aroma is tart and grainy with that Belgian yeast hint, spices, cloves, bananas, and some orange. Flavor is a very nice blend of wheat, spices, and banana flavors from the yeast. The middle has that nice bitter and grainy wheat flavor and the spices suspend for a moment to let the wheat come through. They return for the finish and leave a very light and bitter spice aftertaste.

this is one of the best beers i have had to date, great spice and yeast flavor!
i only buy this beer in the 750ml bottle, i belive it tastes alot better than 12 oz bottles due to bulk aging.

UPDATED: JUL 20, 2010 Honestly, the best cure for the not-so-terrible hangover. the spices, and the wheat are so refreshing, one of my favorite all-around beers, could have this anytime and love it. After the belgian white craze i have been in for the last few months, i appreciate this one even more and truely think it is the best white ale ive had. the oats they use combined with the yeast strain makes a perfect combination.

Draught at The Big Hunt,   Hazy yellow with a medium, frothy head.   Lightly wheaty, yeasty, and spicy aroma with some lemon.   Crisp and dry flavor with wheat, yeast, citrus, light spice and low bitterness.   light bodied with just-lively-enough carbonation.   Great session beer in the Belgian mold.

Deep, hazy gold, thick, white foamy head. Aroma is wheat, hay, grass, washy. Some banana, peach, and cloves. In the background. Softer, less warm than most Belgian styles. Lacing and legs are intense and sticky. 
originally posted at: <a href="http://beercritic.wordpress.com/2009/01
Draft.  Light, sweet aroma.  Well hopped, sweet, and spicy.  This is a solidly flavored Yankee wit, which is a style that I like.

Appearance:  very cloudy, as it should be; white head; questionable head retention

Aroma:  Strong honey and vanilla, spicy wheat, strong coriander, maybe too strong; overall good balance; citrus orange; nice complexity

Flavor:  Overall, great flavor profile; probably the only flaw is a little too much spice power; other than that, great complexity and blend of proper flavors described above

Palate: nice, creamy texture; a little on the thick side

Draft at Uber. Cloudy light amber with very little white head and modest sheets of lace. Mild, lemony, grassy nose. Creamy medium body, subdued carb. Tangy lemon, grass, hay. Maybe a bit of green apple Mild finish.

To explain this one.  Pours a white/yellow color with unfiltered sweetness floating in the brew.  White head.  Smell and taste the spice.  Very crisp yet very relaxing.  Good taste, great smell, wonderful feel.  Great White.
Bottle. Pours a hazy yellow with chunks and a white head.  Aroma is wheat with some slight biscuits.  Taste is very tea-like and not very bitter. Very easy to drink, decent.

On tap at City Beverage in Durham NC this beer was a hazy white almost orangish with lots of floaters - as a matter of fact it was so think and almost orange that with the light in the bar several of my party thought I ordered an oraange juice.  The aroma was of wheat, spice, and some citrus.  Taste was very wheaty along with spice, yeast, cinnamon and a little aftertaste of banana.  A decent beer for the style.

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2009 Pours a hazy gold with chunky sediment and a full white head.  Aroma of honey and bubblegum, but somewhat understated.  Flavor is amazing.  Yeast, bubblegum, coriander, lemon zest, all very well harmonized.  Lingering citrus bitterness.  Juicy, sparkling mouthfeel, medium bodied and very drinkable.
Cloudy yellow, like urine with a bladder infection.  Aroma of bubblegum, taste of grapefruit and soggy bread.  Fascinating.
I had this right after the Maudite at the Hop Leaf in Chicago. Nice beer overall. Not that much head and left me desiring a little more flavor. Beautiful color and very clear.

Poured a cloudy pale yellow color with a very small, disappearing head. Lots of floaters in my bottle. Aroma had a little bit of wheat (could have used a lot more), lemon, and coriander. Flavor was pretty weak. Comparable to a slightly wheat infused Coors light. Palate was way too light and too fizzy.

UPDATED: FEB 18, 2009 A great Belgian wit.  Smooth and refreshing with active carbonation.  Cloudy yellow color with white head.  Flavor is sweet malt, coriander, lemon, yeast, and lots of spices.  Very well done.
On tap toronado.  Nice head and lacing.  Beautiful blond color.  Left me needing some more belgian-ness in the finish.

12oz bottle. Pours a hazy, dark straw color with a medium white head.  Aroma has a fuity sweetness with spice and bread. The flavor has some nice spices but very subtle with some coriander, bread and orange peels. It has a nice lemony zest hoppng and slight tartness on the finish but the flavor fades quick.  A very enjoyable white.
Bottle.  Strong lemony aroma.  Cloudy yellow body, small white head.  Flavor is spicy, medium sweet, and lots of lemon citrus.  Refreshing and flavorful.

12oz bottle. Pours cloudy, straw yellow with a very small, white head. Smells light and crisp cereal malty with a hint of spice. Tastes crisp and and sweet malty with light citrus and light spice. Very nice brew, tasty and refreshing. Medium body, good carbonation.

Bouteille de 330 ml. Nos yeux observent une bière de couleur paille très voilée et un col de mousse modeste et durable. Au nez on découvre des arômes de blé, de levure fruitée, de clou de girofle, de coriandre et de cannelle. En bouche le corps est moyen-rond avec une effervescence faible-moyenne. On goûte des saveurs de blé, de coriandre, de levure, de clou de girofle et de cardamone. Les épices sont très bien balancée.
Loved this beer.  To be honest I am partial to this style, but I really couldn’t find anything I didn’t like about it.  Pours light and hazy.

Bottle.  Pours very light, probably yellow with orange tints.  Flavor is of soft flowers, clove, vanilla and sugar.  A strange beer indeed, given its subtlety and ambient sweetness.  Finishes with more prominent wheat and spice notes, all the while maintaining sweet backbone.

330 mL bottle. This was a disappointment after all of the hype. Pours an unfiltered, hazy, bright yellow with a thin, white head. Aroma is typical witbier: cloves, coriandor, orange peel, and lemon plus some yeasty notes. Taste has a kick of bananas like a good wheat beer. Still lots of spice. Refreshing with a lingering aftertaste of citrus and yeast. Palate is watery and thin. Overall a good witbier but by no means an excellent example.
UPDATED: NOV 18, 2008 Hazy golden yellow, smooth, citrus, yeasty, little grainy, little spice, little bannana.

Pous a hazy amber with a long lasting white as snow head.

 Lemon, coriander,  and a hint of spice greet the nose upon inspection.

 Watery with good carbonation.

 The taste is exactly what you would expect from the smell. The citrus dies into more of a bananna flavor with some background spice. The long aftertaste pokes some hints of wild flower honey.

 Good but not great. Average Witbier that would be enjoy able in the summer with some seafood or in the winter to cut the spice of a nice Thai curry.

Banana yellow, mildly hazy with a thin white head.  Im every Witbier with aroma of coriander, orange peel, spicy yeast and a little lemon.  Taste of heavy yeast, orange peel and some yeast, pretty monotonous throughout.  Ok witbier.
Batch 56.  Pale clear yellow, persistent head.  Ah, light fresh lemon flower aroma!  Soft and light in body, builds in texture with each sip.  Sweet wheat character and wildflower honey notes.
Bottle. High white and lasting creamy off-white head. Hazy yellow green body. Fruity aroma and flavor of mainly banana with high carbonation and a long aftertaste.

bottle - Pours cloudy gold with a fluffy white head and a yeasty aroma.  The flavor is sweet and citrus accented.  Theres also a hint of spice in this light, refreshing brew.  I thought it was good, but not great.
a great white that is not too hard to drink, easy going understated representation that has just enough bie to entice a newcomer to this style

Draft. Cloudy fold with a nice white head. Bubblegum wheat aroma with coriander, ginger, spice, pepper, cloves, banana, and lots of sunscreen. Clean wheat taste. Bubblegum, cloves, honey, coriander and apples. A great go to brew, and also good for non geeks.
Pours cloudy golden orange with a really nice white head.  Great citrus/spice aroma, and a really refreshing taste with near-perfect carbonation.  Smooth and lovely.
Draft. Pours a nice clear gold color with an extreme white head to it. Goes down exteremely smooth and has a nice taste to it.

Hazy yellow body with a slight yeasty browning color and a creamy white head.  Very potent spice and coriander aroma.  Slight lemon and orange citrus notes.  Very nice tastes, smooth wheat body with some coriander and lots of oranges.  Crisp light hops to finish the sip.

12oz bottle, poured a nice clear gold color with a frothy white head, that dissipated fully.  Very aromatic, with hints of wheat, malt, cloves, spices, lemon, and grass.  Taste of wheat, lemon, and spice.  Very crisp and light mouthfeel, quite quenching.  Great beer!

Deep gold, cloudy pour with a big foamy head that lasts.  Nice aroma of yeast, wheat, banana, lemon and spice.  Flavor is good as well, with the yeast lemon peel and spice shining through.  Very refreshing on the palate, makes you want more.  An overall good wit.

Presentation: (Labeled Batch # 33.) It was poured from a brown, corked and caged 750ml bottle into a witbier tumbler. 

Appearance: Its color was light yellow with a hazy body that produced a light white colored head. The head had a soapy appearance with large and small bubbles that hang out for a long time and make nice spotty lace on the glass.

Smell: The aroma is full of wonderful malty wheat tones, yeast and spice.

Taste/Mouth feel: It has a bright vibrant flavor and smooth palate. It has a mostly sweet malt with some wheat tang and nice mild yeast flavor. Coriander and Curacao orange peel give it a good spicy and bitter/sweet citrus touch that works well with the very mild and slightly herbal hops. A smooth creamy texture, medium body and lively carbonation give it a very refreshing character.

Notes: Very well done!!!
bottle, cloudy lemon color, head leaves nice lacing, nose is mild banana, flavor is soft lemon, banana and spice, finish is a bit bitter

Among the domestic white wheats, this offering from Maine is really a standout. It has a wonderfully cloudy complexion and a strong spicy aftertone. Particularly for summer drinking this one is a favorite. Bottoms up!

Very good although probably overrated wit.  I prefer Samuel Adams White Ale, for example.  Anyway this one has severe citrus undertones not subtly masked by a traditional wheat taste.  Pours a nice hazy yellow.  Fairly thick white head, I may have made an over-aggressive pour.  Overall a slight disappointment but worth giving a try if you see it lying around somewhere.

Wheat beers are definitely my favourite and this is a good tasting wheat beer. The only thing I was not to fond of, and hence a lower rating is the essence of spice. I felt there was way to much on the spice side such that it was a little overwhelming. So a decent wehat beer but a little to much spice.

UPDATED: OCT 19, 2008 A thin, antique white head atop an unfiltered light gold body, this white has very soft notes of clove, but a very pronounced, balanced crispness and a clean finish. You must get that yeast out from  the bottom.
On tap at the North Star bar, Philadelphia.  Pours a cloudy gold into the glass.  Smells of bannana and corriander.  Very creamy and refreshing with a fresh hop backbone.  Solid white beer.
this beer had a really dirty after taste that sort of ruined it.  I don’t think it was terrible, but there are so many better wits, especially for the price.

Bottle, shared last night.  Somewhat hazy gold pour with a big white head.  Yeast, bread, spices and sweet malts hit the nose.  Flavor is very yeasty and bready.  Pretty creamy mouthfeel.  Well done style by Allagash.
Bottle: Pours a straw cloudy with minimal white head. Aroma is faint. Flavor is strong spice with citrus. Enjoyed very much.

Tap Capital Ale House downtown 08/26/2008. Lemmon, coriander, and spice aroma. Light yellow straw cloudy with small white head. Big Belgian yeast character with a moderate amount of graininess. Orange lemon zest. Light body with dry zesty finish.

750ml bottle. Poured a hazy gold in color with a medium sized white head that left nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of lemongrass, cloves, citrus and bready.  Tastes of wheat, fruity esters, bread, lemongrass, citrus, and some spices. I had a keg of this a few years a go and it was very enjoyable summer, session beer.  Its still good but not the way I remembered it from back then.

I’m not too impressed with this one at all. Maybe it’s just the style that I don’t care for. While not unpleasant, this White is quite boring with no real character to speak of. Flavor is what you’d expect; Wheat, lemon, and a little pepper. I will finish it easily, but will not be buying again. Will have again only if offered for free.

Bomber from the rip and run. soft nose of lemons arise from this hazy yellow pour. A dense white fluffy head sits proudly upon the pillar of yellow haze. Body is loght and crisp with corriander and cloves.  Citrus sueeze is a skash more intense than the spice that leads to a nice balanced sour finish.

Not much aroma. Poured with a light, fine, white head and a bit of lace. Hazy yellow color. A bit citrus. Kind of indistinct. Sort of crisp. Ok beer. Don’t pick up any of the spice. Not a bad finish. What finish there is though, is short lived.
Bottle.  Very nice appearance large head and hazy body.  Aroma is nice with bananas, bread, and pear.  A bit fizzy but nice finish.  One of the best white beers I have had.

12 oz bottle generously given to me by Gregis. Pour is hazy straw yellow golden with a one inch perfectly white head. Nice full lacing. Only a few tiny carbonation bubbles slowly float to the surface. Aroma of spicy perfumed wheat, slightly sour citrus and soft yeastiness. Soft and fresh. Taste represents the nose quite well, with clove spice wheat, citric sour lemon and a great grainy yeastiness. Some black pepper in the finish, which lingers nicely. Palate is medium and mouth coating, full taste, yet still clean and refreshing. This was a gem, thanks Greg.
On tap at Beachwood BBQ in Seal Beach, Calif. This had a faint hint of spice and wheat. It was very light and crisp, refreshing for a scorching hot day but nothing really unique.
Draft. Poured a hazy golden body. Aroma is light fruit, spices, corriander. Flavor is light spices, floral hops, orange peel. Mouthfeel was nice but thicker body than I expected.
Smooth and frothy, nice cloudy orange body. Wheat flavor with orange, oats and melon undertones. Not a bad white brew.

Draft at McGraths pub in Harrisburg, PA.I have had this in the past many times, but since Ross has a man crush on the brewers at Allagash, I figured I would enter this rating to shut him up. Pours amber orange with a thin white head. Aroma of orange and wheat malts. Medium bodied but with a refreshing texture- with no wateryness. Flavor of orange, coriander, wheat malt, and belgian phenols. Attenuation is normal, somewhere in the middle. Finish has a semi dry yeast and clove dominance, perhaps a very very faint hint of hops. Enjoyable, but not the best wit beer in the universe like Ross makes it out to be.
Nice white beer.  Smells and tastes like an American verison of the Belgium beer where it orginates from.  Medium bodied, orange and corriander.  Almost no hint of hops.  Good for beginners.
This is a quite spicy white. Lots of coriander, some hiding orange. Pretty nice; good and spicy.

A mild smell of lemon/wheat/honey.  Hard to distinguish what all is going on, flavor ends up being a little bit muddy instead of complex.  The banana/clove flavor from the yeast is hidden/muddled in with everything else.  With all my complaints out of the way, its still pretty good (more true to the style than other American attempts I’ve tried).

The aroma is smashing, with definite notes of spice, ranging from coriander, clove, and some nutmeg, and the yeast notes are intoxicating.  It’s appearance is the standard cloudy, unfiltered appearance, with a glowing yellow-white color, and nice full head.  It’s flavor is complex for a white initial a bit citric, but cools immediatley with a full yeasty, but nicely malted mouth, and followed by a dose of spice.  It’s a Hoegaarden w/ more character, if that’s easily believed.  It’s exceptional.  It’s very smooth, and complex when that’s not something associated with this style.  Awesome.

On tap.  Pours with a nice foamy head that persists for quite a while.  Aroma is yeast and spices.  The flavor is fairly typical for a Belgian Wit: yeast and spices, with a bit of citrus.  A slightly sour aftertaste persists.  The mouthfeel is very nice, though not quite as nice as those of many authentic Belgian Wits.  A fine beer.
Bottle and Draught so many times.  Well spiced and balanced out against the belgian yeast flavors.  Wheat and soft fruit blended nicely and a soft mouthfeel to boot.

From tap at Solana Beach as Wit. Pours hazy yellow with a lacng white head. Light wheaty and estery aroma. Flavour is smooth wheaty with a ight coriander spice note. Medium dry and light wheaty into the finish. Mild banana accent coming up into the far finish.

Poured a nice hazy orange color with a big white head. Aroma is very fruity and crisp on the nose. Flavor is much the same, blended well with the added spices. Allagash seems to do belgians styles very well.
At Oregon Brewers Festival 2008 Pours out a cloudy white topped with a white head. Aroma of spice and sweetness. Tast of ligth yeast more of the fruit. Not bad.
On tap. Hazy yellow color and white head. Aroma of wheat, fruit, citrus and cloves. Very effervescent and good body. Dry finish. This is a good Belgian wit.

Had this on tap. A ghostly cloudy white and yellow color. Aroma of sweet fruit, red plum, banana and corander spice. yeasty light taste that helped me finsih the pint in 5 minutes. Much favored over blue moon and the garden of hoes.

This cloudy yellow beer poured with a massive white head that lasted a while. There is a citrus aroma and a wheat flavor that is seriously spiced, but otherwise rather bland. Quite refreshing, but light in taste.

pours hazy light yellow with large fluffy white head, quite beautiful.  aroma is camomile, with some spices and vanilla malt.  flavor is spicy and somewhat sweet, I didn’t really care for the sweetness.  medium bodied.  I really just prefer a drier wit beer.

UPDATED: JUL 28, 2008 Bottle drank in the awesome Clark Street Ale House in Chicago. Pours a cloudy orange color with a thick white head. The aroma is full of spices; especially coriander and lemon peel. The flavor was also tons of spices, a smooth malt, some citrus and banana, and overall a easy and simple beer to drink with a nice thick mouthfeel and lots of flavor.
Awesome beer... cloudy lemon yellow in color.  Nose of bananas and clove.  Really clean finishing on the palate.  Maybe not the best session beer but a nice brew to have a couple of.

UPDATED: JAN 14, 2010 I really enjoyed this Belgian wheat, which is one of my favorite types of beers.  

Nice, crisp taste with a beautiful cloudy color.  Refreshing on the palate and just all around a very nice beer.

Just a tasty belgian white.  Not nearly spicy or lemony as the style usually turns out.  Its got a good thickness and goes down easy when its hot out.  Usually I have pilsners or something in that situation, but I wont turn this away.

On tap @ OTH, pours cloudy golden with a thick white head.
Aroma is coriander. Taste light, yeasty and wheat with a few spices.
A good witbier.

Draught. Nose is faint coriander and sweet orange. Cloudy pale yellow with no head. Flavor is dominated by orange peel and a harsh peppery spice (probably too much paradise seed). Palate is rough. An out-of-balance wit.

bought a single. drank. red stripe broke one, then i bought another ... pineapple, honey light aromas... a simple refreshing refined brew ... a good example of the style ...smooth ... fresh ... enjoyable .. a hit with stu and melanie on the second go...
This pours kind of a murky yellow with a thicker head that quickly diminishes.  The flavor is much stronger than a blue moon with a slight hint of banana.  Great overall taste for a hot summer day.

Pours a dark and cloudy yellow, fairly murky with a medium sized fluffy head. Aroma is sweet orange and banana with some strong malt and citrus spiciness. Flavor has a very sweet start with some mild banana and clove spiciness in the finish. Creamy mouth feel and a medium body. Really refreshing summer beer for those moderately hot days. Way better than blue moon, and really enjoyable.
Tap at Kuma’s. Tried a sample and was underwhelmed. Better than Blue Moon. Pale orangey color, light tasting with a round fat body. Nothing out of the ordinary.

12 oz bottle.  Cloudy straw with a puffy white head that leaves spots.  Nose is wheat, perfume and coriander with bits of citrus peel.  Almost medium with sharp carb but nicely bracing.  Taste is wheat and yeast, mild lemon orange and a smidge of soap.  Good summer stuff.
Cloudy, straw colored with nice white head, no aroma.  Crisp, dry flavor, slightly grassy, with minor hop presence and an underlying citrus flavor.  Palate is on the light side. On tap at The Shep.

Allagash White is an unclear and hazy yellow amber color with a good initial but quickly disappearing white head. The lemon citrus aroma and taste is nicely sour while leading to a dry and bitter finish.

UPDATED: JUN 30, 2008 Bottle. pours a murky gold with a fluffy white head that doesnt go away. Aroma is spicy yeast, bit of citrus. Taste is wheat, crisp citrus and coriander, spicy yeast - classic for the style, but fairly big. Finish is dry and yeasty, with a lingering spicy tartness. Mouthfeel is light but creamy at the same time, never watery. Delicious.

Pours a cloudy lemon color with a nice white head. The aroma is spicy, sweet and fruity. 
Flavor is light crisp and perfect for summer.

Have had this several times over the years and find it to be quite enjoyable and consistent every time.  I like the grainy nose, has that strong breakfast cereal wheaty nose.  Loads of delicious spice, coriander and just a hint of clove.  Light and nicely balanced, with a very pleasant mouthfeel.

Bottle purchased at Sams Wine and Spirits, in Chicago. Pours a cloudy pale straw with a fluffy white head that leaves behind sticky lace. The nose is just about my ideal for the style: full sweet wheat, orange peel, spice (coriander, perhaps a touch of grains of paradise and white pepper) and a light candy sugar note at the finish. Light-bodied and soft without feeling thin, it finishes just a tad tart and dry. A nicely balanced wit with notes of sweet wheat, citrus and light coriander. This is a very solid witbier and is among the best that Ive sampled to-date. I wish I had picked up more of this one.
Hazy yellowish orange.  Fairly light bodied and full of citrus, wheat and yeasty flavors.  Approaches hoegaarden, but not quite there.

12 oz. poured into tumbler- poured semi turbid faded golden orange, white ring around the glass for a head with a small amount of lacing, low carbonation.  Aroma of pepper, lemon, tangerines, lime, and bananas.  Hits the mouth with a low medium body, many of the aromas translate averagely in taste, malt is detectable after some searching, finish is crisp and has some spice.

Bottle. Thick white head. Hazy bright yellow. Lacing. Nice bright yeast character with lots of citrus, spice, pepper, basil, coriander, and fellel spices--lovely. Solid, clean, soft moutheel with good amount of chewiness. Nice peppery body. Substantial and filling. Great malt backbone and high level of quality and complexity.

Pours a cloudy golden color with a nice medium head.  Nice nose of citrus, spice and banana.  Great thirst quencher on a hot day.  Flavor is spice with definite citrus.  The banana on the nose is found on the finish.

Draft. Cloudy banana yellow color with a medium sized, soft, white head. Nose of banana and citrus. Flavors of lemon, yeast, and wheat. Really refreshing, super easy to drink, and a nice overall flavor. Great summer beer to have around on tap.
UPDATED: JUL 31, 2009 Draught at FW Flying Saucer. Really refreshing witbier. Cloudy yellow colour with a foamy white head. Biggest tastes were spice and citrus notes. Crisp finish.
Big bottle, cloudy yellow color, big frosty head. Aroma is zesty lemon. Taste is the same. Lemon, spices. Light in texture, easy to drink. Overall a good witbier that I would buy again!

Good beer and easy to drink. The color is a bit offputting, as it is a neon yellow, but it also has a decent head. Very nice flavor to it that is similar to most wheat beers, but the flavors are more enhanced.
UPDATED: JUN 18, 2008 bottle,not too special, a decent BelGian White. Would not buy again but would drink some one handed one to me.
user_location: The World of Beer, Texas, USA

text: Bottle.  Pours pale yellow with essentially no head.  Mild flavor with the typicaly bel. witbier hints of coriander and orange.  Not much flavor and tasted flattish with barely a head.  Go for Hoegaarden instead...cheaper for a 6-pack than this is for a 4-pack.

bottle. nice cloudy pale yellow appearance. just what you look for in a witbier. the head faded rather quickly but the clove and coriander aroma is there. quite a bit of carbonation but it doesnt detract form the taste. the unique element that allagash has added is a mild bitter which i havent come across in the whites that ive tried. very nice. it gives it a crisp, refreshing edge that is sometimes lacking in this style. balances the sweet banana and spice well. definitely worth picking up.

On tap at Marshallton Inn. pours a light orange with a thick creamy head. notes of pear, banana, orange, lemon, and coriander on the nose. flavor is delicate, slightly acidic, with more lemon and spiciness. refreshing.

Tap at Lenoras way in Brooklyn. So for my 100th rating, I was going to try something special, a bit out of the ordinary. I have a few special beers coming in and was going to wait for one of them to rate, but it didnt turn out as I planned.On this super hot day in NY I wandered in to this bar around noon, and found it empty.The owner let me in and said he wasnt fully open but feel free to sit down. A moment later, someone walks in and they start talking about an event, which I ask them about. At this point they both turn to me, and the owner introduces me to Rob of Allagash. I have  to say I was pretty thrilled to meet him.I had yet to order a beer, but at that point it only made sense to order an Allagash, and the white was available on tap so that made for an easy choice. Now wheat beer is really not my thing, but under the circumstances, and with the fact that Rob  immediately said to the owner, "Ill buy that" made the beer that much tastier.He was extremely nice, and I enjoyed the few minutes that I got to chat with him. So my 100th review didnt go as planned, but it couldnt have gotten much better. Oh yea, the white is pretty tasty, and refreshing on a hot day, even for the non wheat beer fan.
Pours hazy yellow with large head.  Aroma of coriander, orange  and banana.  Very light and refreshing.  Easy drinking.

12oz bottle. pours hazy glowing gold with creamy white head. aroma is wheaty, orange, and floral. flavor notes are wheaty, orange, coriander, and flowers. a light body, med carbonation. this may be the american representation of the style.
Draft:  Hazy yellow colored pour with small white head.  Sweet, wheat nose, hints of banana.  Wheaty, yeasty finish.  Not too bad.
Love this spice filled beer.  The best white i have ever had.  The craftmenship here is remarkable.

I was born in Portland. My wife swears it smells like hotdogs. Hazy colour and lots of carbonation- tickles the tongue. Crisp yeasty flavor like a good Belgian orquebec white. Not too sweet, very sophisticated.
Outstanding witbier.  Ive had this one multiple times, just getting around to rating it now after having it the other night at the Flying Saucer in Raleigh.  Highly recommended.

750 ml bottle (batch 37) - I probably should have drank this beer last year.  Oh well.  Pours a hazy light golden color with a one finger thick head.  Very light spotty lacing.  Aroma is light esters (banana).  Flavor is esters, a hint of yeast, and light malt sweetness.  Palate is fairly smooth, but a tad watery.  A pretty good beer.  I really wish I would have popped the cork sooner.

I really loved this beer, easily my favorite belgian Wit. Great aroma of citrus, and yeast, with some nice banaesque esters. The mouthfeel is almost buttery with a slight caramel flavour that goe sso well with the citrus, and yeast flavours. Wow, just a lovely balance.

12 ounce bottle-  pours out a rich hazy gold, cloudy with a fair white head that left lacing to the dregs.  Aroma was all citrus and yeast, as expected.  Taste was a treat, light and shot through with citrus, very refreshing.  A good "hot day" beer.

The beer pours a hazy yellow with a thin white head. Let me just say that this beer is all about the lemons; lemons on the nose, on the taste and on the finish. But moreover there are hints of sweet malts on the nose and a touch of grass on the taste the finish is lightly acidic and is short lived.
Pretty nice.  Off-clear yellow pour with large frothy head.  Aroma of malt and some spices.  Taste is of wheat malt with allspice, coriander.

Bottles, corked and caged. This is a suprising beer.  Its very light in color and cloudy.  The scent is spicy.  The taste begins very uneventful but swells into spices that really make a pleasant beer.
UPDATED: AUG 25, 2015 Bottled.  A pretty decent witte, poured a cloudy yellow with a citrusy nose. Finish is a bit spicy and clean.

Looks like a standard hefeweizen.  Served at Draught House in Austin with a lemon wedge.  Smells of lemon... or is that the lemon impaled on the edge of my glass?  Semi-cloudy.  Taste is also lemony.  Thin body - easy to drink on Summer days.  Sweet, lifting aftertaste.  Grapefruit, maybe?  The citrus is strong with this one.

I really enjoyed this beer.  The scent has a wonderful citrus and coriander nature.  The beer itself is very aesthetically pleasing, with a pale yellow cloud in your glass.  In terms of flavor, it is very refreshing and easily drinkable, yet still with an assertive spiciness.  The easiest spices to notice are hints of citrus and perhaps some coriander.  

This is a great beer worth at least one try by fans of Belgian pales.

UPDATED: MAR 7, 2009 Thanks to zinister. Nice cloudy, off white color with lots of tasty yeast and wheat floating about. Nose of lemon, tartness, and spices. Very carbonated, fluffy body, very tart and bitter. Light body and a bit alcoholic. One of the better wit beers on the market and what Hoogaarden should aspire to. 3/7//09. Also on tap at the Flying Saucer-even better on tap.  Nice beer.
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text: Cloudy yellow with yeasty and fruity nose.  Flavor was lemon, citrus and yeast with some grain.  Nice balance of fruit and spice, and was glad to have tried on tap.

pours bright yellow with no head to speak of. bubbles nicely. citrus and yeasty flavors, some grassy notes after a few moments on the palatte. a little spice in the background. finishes fairly cleanly, a little hoppier than expected. was ok overall, nothing special.

Bottle from Zinister at his tasting.  Thanks!Pours a cloudy yellow with lively carbonation and a nose of yeasty sweet bread with a touch of raisin.  Flavor is sweet bread with a slight plumb finish.  Thick and slippery mouthfeel.  Nice start to the tasting.
user_location: Ugly, Hot, and Humid Spring, Texas, USA

text: I had this on draught last night, what an awesome taste it had! Pours a bright cloudy golden colour with a large white top, lots of wheat, lemon, citrusy fruit and spice to the aroma. Taste is very pleasent, lively, bubbly and sweet but definately wheaty.

Cold 750ml corked bottle:  Pours a hazy lemon yellow color with a moderate sized frothy alabaster head.  Aroma is of pale malt, lemon, grass and spice.  Taste is of pale malt, subtle grassy hops, lemon and prominent coriander.  Crisp yet smooth, with a medium body and fair carbonation.  Ending is of lightly sweet malt and elongated coriander notes.
Bottle. Haystack yellow with a thin head. Banana, cloves and lemon aroma. Flavor was light, bright and lemony with a crispness. Solid Wit.

Bottle from Whole Foods Charlottesville. Pours a pale straw yellow with a small head. Good lacing. Sweet wheat fruity aroma. Taste is wheat, yeast, sweat and a subtle spice I really had to search for.

Bottle from Capitol Convenience in Concord. Pours light yellow, and cloudy. Thick foamy white crown that hangs on. Aroma is very yeasty, thick bread crust, with pale fruit and a bit of baking spice. Taste is clean, but surprisingly smooth and weighty for a beer of this type. Yeast is visible in the glass. Bread is very palpable in flavor, along with butter, spice, and...what? A sort of sparkling wine feel too. Overall, quite good.
Yellow bodied, white head.  Aromas of banana, citrus, and bubblegum.  Flavor is much the same as the aroma, with detectable spicing.  Thin bodied and somewhat watered down.

Bottle. Pours a pale hue of orange with a pretty bright white head. Yeasty scents abound with a slight champagne grape scent towards the end. Banana flavors with slight nutmeg aftertaste. Sparking mouthfeel. This is an above average Belgian white. Summer is in this bottle.

12oz. bottle. Pours a light gold with a slight haze and highlights of yellow/straw. The head pours medium in thickness and white in color. The aroma is very strong with citrus peel and with the spicy/citrusy smell of coriander. Notes of wheat and a very subtle note of sweetness also show up in the aroma. The flavor starts crisp, light, and dry with spice, a very subtle sweet maltiness, and a good bit of unmalted grain. As the beer nears mid-palate, the spice and orange zest strengthen. There is a nice interplay of coriander, wheat, and hop bitterness at the apex, leading to a crisp, dry, spicy, lemon oil finish. The mouthfeel is full and creamy - considering how light the beers flavor, the body is quite nice (must be from the use of oats). Overall, a decent white beer, but the spice character is almost too prominent - more malted wheat character and more citrus would have been nice, too.

Sampled at the Brickskellers Lupulin Reunulin event with head brewer Rob Tod in attendance.  Pours a cloudy, yellow white with a thin white head.  Aroma is wheaty, zesty, with bananas and cloves.  Very inviting look and smell.  Flavor is similar, plenty of spice, cloves, banana, vanilla and maybe some powdered sugar.  Finish is clean and a little chalky.  Simple, fresh, drinkable session beer.  Well crafted.

12oz bottle shared thanks to zinister.  Pours a hazy, cloudy yellow with thin white head.  This had a smell of spicy wheat and yeast.  Taste was lemony yeast and spices.  Mouthfeel was medium with a dry finish.  Better than some other witbiers Ive had.

...big bottle from knightly spirits.  This stuff was very impressive, and a perfect representation of the style.  Nice, creamy head that lasts, and crisp mouth feel.  Great spicy hints, and curaco making it true to the style.  This beer was great, and I will be trying more from this company.  I just need to find where to get it around here.

Deeply hazy pale ellow  with a towering bubbly white head. Sweaty spicey aroma, a hint of citrus. Very wheaty flavour, with sweet spiciness and a hint of citrus zest. Dry, almost tart finish. This came across as a more austere example of the style, and I loved it for that.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: tap at ft. worth flying saucer.  pale murky golden yellow pour with a layer of white froth.  a nice wheat/yeast scent.  watery mouthfeel but quite nice and smooth with a full flavor.  this is definitely one of the better witbiers ive ever had.
tap at ft worth flying saucer.  citrus aroma, nice wheat and spice flavor.  good beer
Had from the tap at the Gingerman in Norwalk. A full bouquet of citrus and spice. It is very smooth and full flavored. A very enjoyable white.

A nice golden color with a medium white head.

There was a vague scent of clove and hops/

The taste was phenominal, much better than the nose let on. It was a cool and crisp taste, with a hint of mint or clove.

Wonderful mouth feel. Went down smooth, and if I didnt have to get back to work I would have had another.

Serving type: on-tap
Pours a cloudy golden yellow with thin white head.  Citrus fruit aroma.  Quaffable session beer with citrus lemon peel and orange flavor.
Bottle. Pour is hazy orange yellow.  Some spiciness and yeast, fruity and citrus.

Pale straw with a tiny head, no lacing. Aroma is a little spice a little wheat, and plain. Flavor is medium bodied wheat, spice and a little banana scented yeast fart. Feel is a little fizzy. Finish is a bit frainy and  heavier than you would expect.
12 ounce bottle purchased at Total Wine Fort Lauderdale, FL for $2.29. Not bad.
Really good. Light, but full taste. Nice complexity in the wheat and spice. Light yeast flavor in the finish, some citrus flavor. Highly drinkable and refreshing.
Nice spice and wheat nose.  Pours a cloudy orange with a nice fluffy white head.  Nice and light on the palate, with a nice crisp spiced finish.  Overall, a very nice white.
Had this in bottle in Philadelphia. Similar to Hoegaarden but with just enough differences to not make it a copy cat. Little more hops/floral to it than the straight coriander/citrus of Hoegaarden.

Had on tap. Poured to a hazy golden yellow with thin white head that lingered for a short while and left marginal lacing. Nose was citrus and floral, with good spices; allthough these did not translate as well in the flavor. Mouthfeel a decent blend of the fruity hops and a touch of malt sweetness. Clean taste with a nice smooth finish. Not bad.

Bottle->tulip: Pours a large, white, lasting head that exhibits spare lacing on top of a cloudy, yellow body.  Aroma is of cookie, herbs, and light bacteria with some cookie notes as well.  The body is light, the texture is sticky, and the finish is astringent.  Short flavor duration, lightly sweet, acidic, and bitter and finishes vinegary.

Not a bad beer for the summertime, but I think there are other, cheaper alternatives out there that would work better.

UPDATED: APR 27, 2008 Orange spice aroma poured light gold color.  Smooth Belgian wheat that would be good to drink summer BBQs.   Smooth belgian wheat that is drinkable for someone who may be scared of good beer.

3-29-08 tap 

Thick dense pastel yellow white in color with a thin white head.  Smell is funky, citris, and grassy.  Drinkable but a bit thick tasting for me.  Almost too boggy for me.

Honey gold body that is a shade lighter in color than many.  A big white soapy head with good retention.  Lots of carbonation.  Nose of spice and tart fruit with yeast.  It is crisp and refreshing with a nice wheat and yeast flavor.  Only a bit of spice makes it way into the flavor and they are coriander and clove.  This builds with glass temp.  An unsettling dry bitter aftertaste shows up early but fades.  The beer smooths out nicely as it warms.  One of the better Witbiers.
Pours a dirty gold. Lots of spice and slight fruit on the nose. Taste is nice with bannana and clove. Finish is clean and spicy.

On tap at the Flying Saucer. Has a pale golden color with a frothy medium white head.  The aroma is clove banana and a bit of spice. Decent lacing on the glass. The taste is also banana and clove with a dry light spice finish. A good belgian white from Allagash.

Delightful and refreshing.  Pours a cloudy cream with very little head.  The aroma is immediately wheat with just a touch of spice.  The taste is much the same--a wheaty, bready taste with some spice (coriander?) and a hint of citrus.  Mouthfeel is just a bit thinner than Id have hoped, though it does finish very clean and crisp.

What it lacks in complexity it certainly makes up for with its clean, refreshing qualities.  An excellent example of an American wit.

12 oz. bottle. Pours opaque yellow-orange with persistent fluffy white head. Initial smell is strongly of cloves, but later seems to settle down to coriander/lemon. The taste is along these lines, but not too spicy. Nice silky body with unobtrusive carbonation. Very good wit.
A great tasting white beer. Fresh, crisp and great mouth feel. Wonderful head, laces very well. One of my favorites.

Pours a yellow almost cream color topped with very little head. Citrus spiced aroma, mild but pleasant. Spicy citrus flavor seemingly consisting of orange and banana. Mouthfeel is a tad thin and after the initial citrus flavor it turns somewhat bland and watery in the finish. Refreshing and very easy drinking. A nice choice in the hot sun but its too expensive for what you get.

750 ml bottle
super creamy mouth feel...nose of coriander and some citrus.....
taste is creamy and mildly spicy and super refreshing
UPDATED: APR 4, 2009 Draught.  Golden cloudy pour with thin white head.  Aroma of yeast, bananas, and citrus fruit.  Taste of wheat and spices.  A little thin on the finish, but a decent summer brew.

Bottle.  Pours a pale cloudy orange with a small but foamy white head.  Aroma is citrusy and spicy, but mostly wheaty.  Tastes very clean and crisp - less wheaty than it smells.  Finish is nice and clean.  Very drinkable witbier for the upcoming summer.

750ml bottle from Total Wine Tampa. Pours a bright, cloudy yellow with a one finger white head. Aroma: flowery and spicey. Tastes of citrus, spices, flowers, fragerant soap and perfume. Interesting witbier.

UPDATED: OCT 15, 2008 First rating: 6/3/7/4/14 = 3.4

Re-rate: Draft. Pours unclear goldenrod with a white heads. The aroma is lemony citrus with an awesome spicy kick of nutmeg and clove. The flavor is very similar, with a nice balance of citrus and spice, but has a very light soapy-ness that detracts a little bit. Good nonetheless.
cloudy pour, style right?  wheat in the nose, spice in the mouth.  its subtle, its light, its not for me.

Sample on tap at the draughthouse courtesy of fly.  Thanks!Pours murky yellowish white a light whitish head atop.  Smell is very wheaty, more so than spicy to me with hints of citrus.  Taste is equally wheaty, with a lesser spiced influence which I like about it.  Hearty, flavorful and drinkable, and a style Im perhaps coming around on, a bit because of examples like this.  Good witbier.

This pours a nice cloudy yellow with a fluffy white head. Smells like a white beer should, fresh and citrusy. Also tastes like I had hoped it would - crisp, citrusy, slightly carbonated. Very slightly bitter aftertaste, but overall very clean finish. I give this high marks due to high drinkability. I suspect Ill be drinking more of this during the summer.
On tap.  Very fruity and easy to drink.  Served with orange, and picked up a lot of sweet orange flavors.  Not very spicy.  Very easy to drink.

On tap at Plan B, served with a slice of orange.  Pours a cloudly yellow with slight white head.  Tastes of your typical Belgian witbier with a nice blend of spices in the finish.  Good, refreshing beer but make sure you drink it while its still cold.

750ml bottle from BevMo Mission Valley.  The pour reveals a slightly cloudy yellow color with a medium, creamy, white head. The aroma has a solid presence of wheat with some lemon and mild spices. The flavor is solid, the lemon is more up front than in the aroma, theres still a good wheat presence with some yeast and spices. The body is full with a creamy texture and mellow carbonation. A very fine wit bier.

750 ml, labeled Batch #44. Pale, hazy gold with a large head that settles into a lasting ring and leaves meringue all over the glass. Light aroma of yeast, peppery citrus, and slight bubble gum. Same stuff is more pronounced in the taste.  Almost seems like cinnamon in the way aftertaste. Light body is soft, dry, tingly and astringent. One of the best Wits out there.
On tap Tria, Philly Beer Week.  Nice cloudy straw yellow pour, light and summery, hints of lemon, some crispness. balanced, refreshing.

12oz Bottle. Crisp yeast and bread dough aroma, spritzed with orange oil and light spice. Pours an opaque pale sunshine yellow. Little head. Nice prickly carbonation. Flavor is a very soft, smooth quaffable cool wheat water. Winter wheat oils, lively yeast and accenting spice notes. Even on the palate. A light, older hop floral figure in the back. Heavily drinkable and paired nicely with smoked salmon bruschetta. A good rendition.

12 oz bottle.  Hazy onion skin yellow with minimal head.  Banana and spice are prominent in the aroma.  Clove and coriander seem to be the dominant spice.  A fairly thick smelling brew.  Spicy, yeasty flavor with hints of sweetness are what you will get on tasting this one.  Sweetness provided via banana and clove.  Fairly wet mouth feel and crisp body.  Not a huge fan but this is drinkable.

Pours (from a bottle) a nice golden color with a full white head, leaving a film behind on the rim of the glass. Very refreshing  light bodied beer with a bit of spice. Not very complex but still works. Overall a decent beer.

On tap at Beer and Wine Boutique in Placerville.  Im not a huge fan of Witbiers, but this one was an improvement compared to ones Ive had.  Very limited carbination, although it has sizable head.  The flavor was odd, and I couldnt place it, largely because I had about 2 oz. to taste.  It was ok.
franziskaners lighter American brother.  slight cloudy yellow color, nice smooth fruit taste. very clean and refreshing. worth a try anytime
On Tap.  Pours cloudy gold woth small white head.  Aroma of citrus, grass, and yeast.  Flavor of bananas and flora.  Nice white.

Picked up a single 12-oz bottle at Flanagans Liquors in Appleton, Wisconsin. Pours a semi-clear golden pale brew with a fast dissolving white head that leaves behind a fine film and white ring. Aroma of light multi-grain malt, some citrus zest, light herbal spice, and a touch of banana esters. Taste is medium bodied, light carbonation with a more wit flavor than its aroma. More banana, yeast and clove flavors come out in the taste. Finish is semi-sweet, a little watery with a dry banana and yeast aftertaste flavor.

20? oz bottle. Poured a golden yellow with a little cloudiness not as much head. Some citrus on the nose. It was light  and the flavor was not very complex as you may expect from Allagash. Stick with Hoegaarden.

Poured from tap a light pale blond with nice creamy white head.  Lots of spice and citrus in the aroma.  Taste of clove, banana, citrus with a bit of bubble gum sweetness.  It ends a bit dry and powdery with not enough carbonation to give a great acidic pop like other wheat beers.  Overall, great flavor I just wish they upped the carbonation.

Pours light lager color with minimal head. Nose of citrus caramel with a hint of hops and yeast. Very crisp mouthfeel with dry finish. A bit thin on the palate though. Flavors of citrus, floral malt with some hop astringency near the end. Very tastey and very drinkable- a winner for its style.

pretty solid aroma, nice for a witbier. appearance obviously not as impressive as a dark beer, but nice coloration. very nice flavor- citrusy first hit, with a very dry finish- more complexity than your typical witbier. palate pretty ordinary, but not bad. very tasty beer overall.

Batch 24:  A very pale yellow with moderate amount of particulates and zero head/lacing.  Lemon and yeast dominate here both in flavor and aroma.  Nothing special here...one small step above Blue Moon, unfortunately no giants leaps in brew-kind.

Served fairly cold into a tumbler from a 12 oz bottle. Poured a cloudy orange with yeast particles and whitish head that was fairly small. Aroma was of citrus, yeast and spice. Flavor is strong in citrus, orange in particular but very smooth with a small and unique hop and spice bite at the end. Good carbonation. A very solid white if not as great as some abbey whites. This beer is also very drinkable and sessionable.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2008 On draft at Oldsmar Tap House. pours a murky orangish yellow, with a soapy fluffy white head, and ridiculous lacing. Aroma of clove, bubble gum, straw. Flavors of soft wheat, clove, olive, cracker, muted banana. Soft bodied, well balanced, easy drinking. Nothing crazy, but decent.
12 oz bottle thanks to Jared.  Poures a light orange color and smells of orange peel. Smooth body and decent lacing.  Better than a Blue Moon but nothing to impressive.
12oz - Cloudy hazy pale orange pour, shortlived fizzy head, orange peel and spices on first taste, good tribute to the real Belgian whites.

UPDATED: JUN 22, 2008 wheaty yellow pour.  Aromas of citrus, slight vanilla cream. tasted light, refreshing, slightly citrus. perfect.  palate was soothing and cool.    Not my favorite style but this one was quite refreshing, simple and perfect.     A beer I will be drinking all summer.

Pours to 3" creamy head. Pale amber yellow, translucent. Aroma of clove, fruit and flowers. Taste of clove followed by slight bitterness. Light and refreshing. In mouth, foaming carbonation; palate cleaning. Very nice all the way around.

The beer smelled of wheat citrus and yeast. The taste was cream med to full body beer with wheat citrus, and a bit yeasty. The finish was quick. Not a bad beer has more flavor than hoegaarden but that is it.

Batch #35.:       .750ml bottle.  Hazy golden yellow, creamy white head.  Aroma of spice, bread, yeast and lemon zest.  Flavor is of wheat, yeast, spice and (strangely) perfectly cooked seascallops.  Very light bodied.  Very refreshing.  Perfect for this style (Better than Hoegaarden).

Draught at Pub in Ida Noyes.  Hazy yellow with thick white head.  Looks like lemon meringue pie.  Aroma is lemony, wheat and spice.  Taste is citrusy (not artificial tasting) wheat beer, some spice (coriander and clove).  Mouthfeel is a bit thin and the beer just needs a little something more at the end.  However, a very good example of one of my least favorite styles.
Hoegaarden glass.  Hazy straw color with small head.  Aroma of lemon/citrus wheat and spice.   Taste is similar.  Spicy and sour finish.

very nice white beer, pours cloudy and light yellow with a decent head, good yeasty aroma with a hint of spice, flavor is standard wheat beer with spicy notes, very mellow hop notes makes this beer a nice summer refresher

Pours a cloudy light gold color with a smallish white head.  Smells of wheat, some spice, yeast, and a little sweet cinnamon in there too.  Quite pleasant.  The flavor is very crisp and refreshing.  Good spice and wheat characters.  A little orange peel, coriander, and cinnamon spice round out the flavors.  This is an excellent rendition of a Belgian wit in my opinion.  Full flavored, crisp, refreshing, with good body to it.  Well done.

Draft @ redlight redlight.  Spicy nose, corriander, wheaty, somewhat sweet aroma with hints of citrus.  Pours cloudy yellow with a thick white head.  Sweet citrus up front, spicy corriander, yeasty flavors, very wheaty, very refreshing.  Excellent wit.

Yay.  Actually got this in my home town little bitty beer store.  Very white color.  Great aroma.  Full of clove, coriander, orange and even some cinnamon.  The flavor is warm and balanced with great wheat flavors backed up by the spices promised in the nose.  The body is medium to light, but shouldnt it be?  Its a damn Witbier.  Get down off your horse and all that.

Nice yellow beer, with a hint of orange coloring. There is not much head to speak of. The head quickly fades away. Average looking beer. Bananas, yeast, a some clove are in the aroma. It is not overly pungent. The smell is decent.  There is nice lacing that accompanies the beer. The beer is nice and smooth. Very rich, a nice palate. The flavor is not great. There is not much to this flavor. Subtle ctirus, banana, and yeast flavor. Just a bland flavor if you ask me. The flavors dont jump out at me that much. The commercial Witbiers seem to have a better taste. This beer is very middle of the road. Smells sweeter than it tastes. The beer could use some tweeking on the flavor, but other than that a decent beer.
Big fruity floral citrus aroma with orange peel and corainder. Tatse is very big on the spices. Light bitterness, nice big fluffy head every pour. Beautiful cloudy orange body. Very nice.
Draft at Ashleys in Ann Arbor.  Pours a golden yellow.  Tastes of citrus and coriander, with a lot of carbonation.  Smooth, but a little boring.

Tap.Hazy golden color with a short lived white head. Aroma of spices and citrus. Creamy mouthfeel. Wheat, citrus, coriander and pepper flavors. Spicy finish. A nice white beer, just not one of my favorite styles.

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2008 I had batch # 36.  This is a very nice, tasty wheat beer.  Its a cloudy light gold with a big, bubbly white head that slowly diminishes to a smaller lasting head with a little weak lacing.  The aroma is grain, wheat, banana, and dough, with a faint hard-to-pin down element that might be the spices added to it.  It has a nice light wheat beer flavour of grain, bubblegum, with a banana-grain finish and a light hint of spice.  Its a little oily with a zesty sweetish quality, very smooth and pleasant, but  a little too sweet.

[743-20071006] 750mL (Batch #29). Weird spice and light tobacco wheat aroma with a weird pine background. Hazy, yellow light brown body with a quick off-white head. Belgian wheat and strange spicy alcohol wheat flavour. Medium body. Almost resembles flavoured carbonated soda.

Bottle for christmas dinner went well with the cornish hen we ate.  The yeast and citrus cut through the fat of the meat.  Big aroma of citrus and yeast.  The orange and lemon flavors combined with the wheat and yeast give this one a big body with some subtle fruity characteristics.  Banana and bread add to the complexity of this one.

Sampled at GABF 2007. Pours a hazy opaque deep gold with a matching white head. Banana esters and cloves to the aroma. Very wheaty flavor with a banana bread taste. Mildly sweet and a quick tart crisp finish. Good beer.
750ml bottle Batch #38; nose of yeast and citrus; urine yellow with a medium yellow tinged head; flavor is peppery, yeasty, and wheaty; finish a very weak bitterness.

A cloudy honey-amber golden with a nice thick head. Aroma is fruity and malty with strong banana and lemon tones. The rich wheaty flavor fairly fills the mouth, and the strong hoppy bitter undertone gives it a nice kick! It goes down smoothly with a strong alcohol bite that is more like hard liquor than beer.
Beautiful full and soft body. Well spiced with pepper, poultry seasoning and perhaps green peppers? Some rye bread in there too. Big fan of this beer.
A nice golden fluffy beer.whrat on hte nose with some breadiness.Flavor was light easy drinking and crisp.A good wheat and yeast flavor.Finish was clean and nothing hanging around for later.
As far as wheat beers go this one is pretty good. Pretty smooth but falls short of some others from this brewery.

Bottle.  Poured a cloudy grapefruit-like color with a small head.  Aroma had a lemon scent.  It tasted tart/sour with a slight lemon flavor with a crisp, bitter finish.  It was moderately carbonated.  The mouthfeel was light.  Pretty good beer, not great.

12 oz. bottle in tumbler. Right upon twisting the cap, theres a smell of cheap lager. I finally catch a little coriander as it settles. Pours slightly cloudy, but clears as it warms up a little. Could this be more an interpretation of a Blue Moon? Well, taste brings in some nice sharpness from spices and a little more hop than the style should need. While Im not the biggest fan of wheat esters, I actually missed them from this beer. But... swirling the last bit in the bottle and pouring the yeast gave me a familiar cloudy body and a light custard head, however brief. More of the usual wit flavor was there. Yeah, thats it. The yeast must have settled more than usual and needed to be stirred in better. Carry on.

THOUGHTS: I think its the first time Iver tried a small bottel of Allagash. I was a little nervous but the quality was still there. Very refreshing, but not the best wit.
TECHNICAL: Bottle. Poured a pale yellow that was very cloudy and almost white. The whitest, wit I think Ive ever had. It had a small, white head that mostly diminished except for a thin sheet and left fair lacing. The aroma was lemon, light to moderate yeast and wheat. The initial flavor was lightly sweet and moderately acidic, while the finish was moderately sweet and lightly acidic and sour with an average duration. The flavor was mostly lemon, wheat and yeast. The light to medium body was slightly dry with fizzy carbonation and a light to moderately astringent and dry finish.
pours a hazy shade of gold with light head and little spotty lacing!  Slight banana aroma. citrus and coriander but not overwhelming.

Bottle: Pours a cloudy honeyish golden with a white creamy head. Simple aroma. Mainly damp, papery wheat malt; lacking citrus & spices. The flavor is simplistic as well, having a banana sweetness and plenty of yeast character. Has a mild papery finish. There isnt enough citrus or spices in this example of a Witbier. I expected more from this brewer for this style.

Cloudy yellow pour with a billowing white head and nice lacing.  Lemon, banana and yeast in the aroma.  Mouthfeel is good, lots of carbonation.  Taste reveals some citrus, more lemon.  Somewhat tart middle.  Yeast lingers into the finish.  Finish is a bit sour.  Overall, very good.

Pours a cloudy pale yellow color with a bit of yeast on the bottom of the bottle. Small head... I think this beer may be a bit stale because there is a skunky nose and the taste is a bit marijuana like. Anywho... there is a nice wheat like taste to it but there is not much to this beer style. Just ok.
Draught at Sheffields, ChicagoMuddy light blond color. Light aroma, some wheat, spices, citrus fruits. Simple flavor; poor, with a hint of citrus fruits. Useless to me.

On draft, consumed 11/19/07.  Cloudy, light yellow color typical of this style, although the damned lemon wedge was not.  Aroma is lemony citrus - cant tell how much was the beer and how much was the lemon wedge.  Flavor likewise lemony with yeasty, spicy clove flavors and hints of grass.  Clean finish.

A fabulous beer all around in an under-rated style.  Wheats get little respect from many in here, but this is one that should be savored.

Pours a beautiful hazy yellow with a small white head.  Consumed sans fruit.  Aroma is strong citrus and floral notes - some lemon, perhaps some rose or vanilla as well.  Flavor is a wonderful blend of sweet malt and just a touch of bitterness to balance out the brew.  Yeasty esters are prevalent in aroma and flavors.  Im a big Allagash fan.  This is one reason why.

cloudy white/yellow pour with a small frothy white head.  aroma of banana, vanilla, and some lemon.  nice grainy, banana, lemon flavor.  light-med bodied.  sharp carbonation.  good plain solid example.

Pours cloudy yellow/golden with a small fizzy white head. Semi-sweet candied lemon zest aromas, with an overall grassy note. Flavor is of watery lemon grass and doughy yeast, but little else. Palate is light, slightly tart, and watery. Not bad, but as I said, watery and very one-dimensional.
Mmmmmmmm......tasty.  This beer has a very light finish and a great fruity body.  I like it best in the huge bottle!

12 oz. bottle.  Pours a cloudy, light yellow.  Fluffy, medium sized white head sticks to the side of the glass.  Slight aroma of bananas and clove.  Body is a bit lemony with pepper thrown in for good measure.  Finish is very dry.
After a string of overly banana-and-coriander flavored Wits and Hefes, this was refreshing.  Crisp, with some fruit flavor, but not overwhelming.

From Great Lost Bear in Portland, Maine.  Served with a lemon (not appropriate in our opinion). Poured a cloudy straw golden color with tints of slight copper. big bustling white head. Nose of Belgian yeast but not as clove or banana-esque as many whites. Light sweet and tart mouth feel.  Soapy and thin.  Not as spicy as one might hope for in a white or witbier.
Pours hazy yellow with great notes of spice (clove) and citrus.  The palate drives the spice in a bigger way with a nice crisp finish.

Sampled @ GDBTF.  Pours deep golden amber, slight white head. On the spicier side, with discernible coriander, peppery on the nose, tart lemony palate, very smooth for the style, goes down nicely.  Look forward to trying more of their beers.
Virtually no aroma off this (on tap at C&O).  mild lemon and yeast flavor, with virtually no banana (a big plus)

Pours a hazy sunny yellow with very little head that dissapates quickly.  Aroma of spice, wheat and citrus.  On the palate there are hints of orange and corriander weaved in with the wheat mash.  Rounder.

Pours a cloudy yellowish-white. The aroma is a blend of wheat, yeast, citrus, and coriander. The taste is somewhat dry, with bits of spice, orange, lemon, and wheat. Overall a nice blend and pretty refreshing.

Pours frothy white head with lacing. Cloudy yellow colour it has. The aoma was rather citrusy, without as much banana as other witbiers have. Taste also is really fruity. Lemon or grapefruit is the most prominent. Banana takes back seat here again as well. Good level of carbonation. Also it is slightly sweet.
Great rendition of a style I normaly do not like.  Great session type beer.  All the typical spicy lemon flavors give it a nice crisp finish.

from bottle.  pours a hazy yellow brown with a thin white head that fades to a film at the edges, and leaves a very slight lacing.  smell is fairly strong bananas and cloves, and spices mixing with orange notes for a beneficial effect.  tastes of wheat with the spice taking over the bananas and cloves, which are still there, but not as noticeably.  the orange comes out a bit more in the taste.  finishes dry with a hint of both bitter and sweet, with the moderate (but tiny) carbonation creating an almost creamy mouthfeel.

This beer has a cloudy orange color with a golden head that fades rather quickly. it has a tangy smell of lemon grass and strong citrus. As you drink it there is a lot of clove and hops on the tounge. the clove kind of coats the back of your mouth as well as some hints of lemon and orange peel.
This is part of a beer club tasting. Only had one bottle but it was a decent taste for the price. Would like to try again after it poured great and left a nice after taste.

Pours a cloudy golden color with a white head.  Aroma is of citrus, lemon, banana, wheat, and some yeast.  Flavor is all the same with some spices and a nice crisp finish that lingers.  Another great Allagash brew.
Quite delicious and very true to the style.  Nice citrus bite, crisp, and utterly refreshing! Very well done and recommended!!

12 oz bottle - a liquid the color of a bleached dandelion, hazy with a white head atop.  strong aroma of breaktast wheat , like frosted mini-wheats. starchy and sweet, with lots of residual sugar apparent, and lightly spiced.  flavor is a mild wheat and spice, with a few estery yeast elements but largely a neutral body.  very refreshing and and crisp finish despite some sweetness - appropriate for a warm late-summers night.
Bottle.  Aroma primarily spices and wheat.  Pour is a nice crisp yellow gold.  Flavor is nice as welll just as advertised in the nose.  Palate is light airy and crisp. Tasty
aroma: great smell of coriander and other spices. Appearance: cloudy light yellow, w/ small foaming head. not so carbonated. Taste: nice taste for a witbier. slightly dry but overall good.

Pours a hazy golden colour with a medium frothy white head. Aroma of wheat, orange peal, clove, and slight hops. Initial taste is wheat, yeast, citrus, clove and corriander. Finishes with a soft sweet palate. Light body, crisp and dry finish that lurks you for more.  Some minor head retention and lacing of the glass. A very enjoyable Wit.

Poured a cloudy straw color with frothy white head and even lacing. Smelled of alcohol and wheat with little hoppy aroma. Tasted like a traditional Belgian without the high carbonation. Good beer from a good brewery.

Pours cloudy, yellow, with a fine, white head. Aroma is yeasty with a bit of banana, vanilla, and spice. Moderate mouth feel with a spicy, yeasty flavor. Vanilla, banana, and some mildly hot spices make a pleasant belgian.

Tap at the Matchbox.  Thoroughly hazy golden yellow with a lovely whipped cream head.  Sweet aroma of caramelized onions, honey, and bananas.  Clove taste with a quiet green apple and lemonade tartness.  Dry, papery, yeasty.  Palate is mildly undercarbonated with light to medium thickness, finishing very thin.  Simple and sweet.

Pours a transparent yellow.  Aroma is very skunky upon initial pour but as it warms up it smells more of clove, wheat, and citrus.  Taste is a mixture of wheat and lemon.  What is lacking in his brew is the finish; it is very flat.  Other than that it is actually pretty solid and surprised me after the initial smell.

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2009 
Date: October 19, 1997
Mode: Draft
Source: Great Lost Bear, Maine
Appearance: cloudy yellow, thin head, lots of lace
Aroma: strong citrus and clove aroma
Flavor: lots of wheat flavor with just a hint of clove lasting through a long finish 

Date: July 06, 2006
Source: tasting
Score: ii to ii+
nice lemon in the aroma, 

Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 7/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 13/20
Rating: 3.2/5.0Drinkability: 8/10
Score: **+/4
