Altogether, I found it to be enjoyable and a fun drink.  Theres a distinct yeasty flavor in the finish, which is actually really nice.  Hops are pretty much non-existent.  A nice change from my normal beer habits.  Id get it again.

Belgian white is one style I really dont care for, but I gave this one a whirl any how, this didnt have that churned up veggie flavor that I find in a lot of white beers, lakced a little body, nice lacy soft white head, decent white beer
Probably one of the best wits out there... full corriander and curacao flavor, smooth finish

A Belgian ale without the overwhelming taste of yeast.  Orange peel and corriander.  Hazy, yellower than a German wheat beer.  Stands up nicely to a pepperoni pizza, which complements the yeast that is present in the flavor.  An enjoyable beer to drink, but not a beer to study or write about.
Slightly hazy light yellow color. Large white head. Strong corriander aroma. Some bubble gum. Spicy, citric, slightly bitter, yeasty flavor. Medium-to-light bodied. Refreshing. A darn nice Wit!

A nice white beer, but not the best.  A light spice added to some citrus fruit and a touch of sweetness.  Not my favorite white as I found the flavors to be too weak, but all in all, a nice, easy drinking beer.

Semi-cloudy, light golden color.   Corriander(?) and other spices in the nose as well as the taste, but more subtle than the few other white ales Ive had (Belgian and not).   Spice lingers in the finish.   Best Ive had of this style so far.

Bottled. Pale hazy lemon, low head and moderate condition. Spicy corriander and lemon in the nose and the body along with a slight tartness. Finish is sweet and chalky. Prefered this to the Cabot Street Wheat that I tried at the same time.

UPDATED: MAR 23, 2003 Something of a lesson in coriander.  Cloudy pale gold body with fluffy white head.  Big aroma of citrus and spice with mouth of spice and sweet light malt.  Superbly balanced and pleasantly dry in the finish.  Great Witbier.

Cloudy, lemon yellow appearance.  Very nice aroma of oranges, spice (coriander among others), and yeast.  The body is spicy and yeasty with nicely balanced hop bite.  This beer is on the edge of being too hoppy for the style, but pouring the yeast in the glass really relaxes the hops and creates a beautifully balanced and complex Wit, although lacking the banana notes that I love.  Nice work here.

WONDERFUL!   An exceptional beer.  The combination of orange & corriander make the Belgian White one of my favorite beer styles.  This is equal to the old Celis White or Hoegaarden White.  Its no wonder this just won a gold medal at the GABF!
A excellent wheat beer. I think one of the best I have ever had.
slightly cloudy, thin head. huge aroma of clove..citrus is dominant in the flavor with a spicy aftertaste...very malty yummy Wit!
Nice white beer.  Not as good as Hoegaarden though.

Much better than their pathetic attempt at a Belgian Ale.  It is a cloudy pale lemon chiffon in color, with the typical witbier head.  Nice notes of citrus (especially orange) and coriander in the nose.  The palate is average.  The flavor is vintage Belgian White, hitting all the right notes.  Overall, a tasty little beer.
Big coriander and orange. Good wheatiness.

UPDATED: JAN 25, 2003 Hazy pale yellow-gold hue.  Nice rocky white head with nice lacing.  Aroma of apricots, coriander, curacao, yeast.  Nice mouthfeel, light at first, medium bodied, very wonderful steady carbonation, and spicy finish.  Peppery and pleasant in the end, very nice spiciness.  A very delectable brew....and its American!
UPDATED: APR 23, 2009 The best American Wit I have tried to date. About as good as Wits get. Really!!
Citrusy taste with a fairlyu sweet flavor overall.  Nice and cloudy with a good fruity aroma.  A very good beer.

Tart nose, got a little lemon and smoke at the beginning.  Might sound strange, but calamata olives come to mind through the finish.  If I didnt have more beer to rate, I would order a pint or two more.

Best white beer ever.  Loaded with complex flavors.  Appearance is perfect.  nice and cloudy with a milky whitish gold with an awesome head and great carbonation, but not spritzy.  Lots of bitter and sweet orange peel, coriander, pepper, and maybe some cumin.  Sweet yet balanced with nice bitterness and tart fruit flavors.  My new favorite wit.

Batch #1. Head is initially average sized, fizzy, white, mostly diminishing. Body is hazy medium yellow, dense tiny particles, bottle conditioned. Aroma is lightly malty (light bread), lightly yeasty (dough), lightly hoppy (flowers), with notes of coriander and lemon.  Flavor is moderately sweet, moderately acidic. Finish is moderately acidic, lightly bitter. Light to medium body, watery texture, fizzy carbonation. Decent but unexciting witbier.

Light cloudy straw color with a bright white head. Orange citric aroma with a touch of spice.  Medium body with with flavors of orange and dry honey.  Finish is quite mid and unassuming.  Not a bad domestic wit.

Not really to my liking.  The color was a very pale yellowand the head was thick and foamy.  the aroma was spicy yet sweet with a hint of citrus, most likely orange.  the flavor was sweet with spicy bitter undertones.
Just a bit too much hop bitterness for a witbier. Otherwise, is a pretty good example of the style, with nice citrus flavors, a peppery spiciness, moderate sweetness, and some hints of banana esters.
Nice golden color.  Strong aroma of coriander and orange peel, also yeast products.  A well-rounded body with appropriate spiciness.
Portland,Belgium? neverheard of it,oh Maine huh,well thats even more impressive,thanks Rob Tod
Pretty good! nice tasting white beer.  Fruity and a little spicy.  Recommended
Spicy orange aroma, crisp spicy and fruity, average wit.

pale yellow-orange colour, almost no head, very deep spicy aroma (cinnamon, coriander), citrusy, perfumy, sweet and tart, honeyish with a short finish - they just tried to make too much of it and the result is unbalanced and artificial - a bad clone of the Blanche de Bruges
Wonderful aroma, very good head retention and very fruity on the palate.  A refreshing beer, I think Ill have another.

very pale cloudy straw color, foamy white head, 
aroma of oranges, coriander.
the spice taste is quite strong,  giving a good balance of flavors.
an exceptional wit.

Quite a complex aroma for a wit:  musty, doughy yeast, barnyard (first time Ive used that one...), squash, and corriander.  Sharp, but not as sweet as other wits Ive encountered (not necessarily a bad thing).  I think warm summer squash is a spot-on description of how this beer tastes.  Definitely subtle, I had to get through half the glass to realize how much I liked it.  A little under-carbonated...damn screw-off tops.

UPDATED: JUL 24, 2009 Beautifully balanced wheat and spices (white pepper, ginger, and coriander?) in a superb aroma and more diplomatic flavor profileCitrus fruit of course and a whisper of herbal hops in the finishLots of wheat flavor too for a super refreshing Witbier

This beer poured a light, cloudy straw color and formed a small white head that left little lace. Quite a bit of carbonation to it. A citrus and slight hops aroma to it. The taste was of citrus, spice which was probably coriander and some hops. The finish was a touch tart due no doubt to the spice element and the heavy carbonation. A good summer beer.
It has a pleasantly hoppy, spicy aroma, a deeply spicy palate and full body.
Great brew.  Tones of citrus and spice jump out at you in this beer.  Very refreshing, perfect summer beer.

(Bottled 6/10/02) Wow. A blast of spice and orange in the nose. The beer has a great head. The carbonation level is very refreshing. The palate is complex with notes of citrus, coriander, and yeast. One of the best Wits

Re-Rate 06/15/02: Cloudy gold (Chill Hazed}, white head and generous lace. The nose is grainy, citrusy, somewhat sweet. Front is sweet, the top light, the finish is acidic, lightly dry, lightly hopped and quite drinakable.

Lovely golden color with a chill haze appearance. Soft and fluffy white head. Aromas of orange, coriander, cinnamon and pepermint(?). Flavor of orange and coriander come through. The beer has a peppery, zesty appeal. Sooo smoooth for a wit. Awesome!
I guess that it is a realitivly new brewer it is pretty good, but, I have found german wheats to be much better.
This is my least favorite wit, thus far.  It was heavily spiced and I didnt detect much fruity esters or much else other than light fruit and overwhelming coriander.  Extremely pale in the glass.

First of all, what stood out for me was the overall quality - this may not be a beer that I would have everyday, but someone obviously put a lot of care into making it.  A very nice combo of fruity flavors kept it interesting with every sip.  very nice.

Very pale, just hints of yellow in the glass.  Cloudy as expected.  Fine nose, very spicy, some candy also.  Flavor is very spicy, lots of lemon zest, bubble gum, banana, and yeastiness.  Nicely carbonated, crisp and fizzy.  Will become a standard warm-weather brew in my future.
This brew had a fruity flavor to it.

The predominant aroma/taste I got from this was apricot. The beer had a nice tang to it, naturally cloudy, and not too carbonated. Could have been a bit more yeasty in flavor, perhaps a little more hops. Just a bit too watery. Overall I enjoyed it.
American brewing companies are just never able to adequately brew belgian whites.  This is one of the better ones, but still lacking in the spiciness and the finish is just not right.  Too yeasty...
I dont know why I keep trying wheat beers, because they are just too fruity for me. It is probably a good version of the style, but I just dont care for it.

I have to defer to Wit experts on this one. All I know is I liked it; it was light and quaffable, but still a nice taste challenge. The taste was not one-dimensionally pine, nor licorice, but a mellow combination of those. Very grassy. Good stuff, and thanks Jayme_9874.
user_location: Łódż, Warsaw, Poland; Michigan, Ohio, USA

text: I definately prefer the Hoegaarden for this style, but for domestics I would choose it over the Victory.  Nice aroma, interesting hints of candied lemon along with the traditional wheat stuff.  Not quite as spicey as I would hope for, a bit watery.

Probably my favorite beer of this style I have tried thus far.  Its light on the palate, has a full wheat flavor.  It does not overpower with the spices, and frutiness, that others in this style do.  Very tasty.
Cloudy yellow with a white head, spicy orange flavors, nice mellow finish. Excellent.
Nice pale yellow color with the traditional cloudy haze to it.  Very spicey flavor with lemon/tart overtones.  Clean and crisp palate with a nice finish.  This is a very good wit.

OK whitebeer. Surprisingly little head. Taste licorice or anise. A bit of bubble gum as well. Refreshing warm weather beer OK for guzzling as a thirst quencher. Nothing special. Not much aromatics going on, mildly hoppy.
The best American white beer Ive tasted. Better than Victorys even.
Great cloudy color with a rael zesty white flavor:lemon,orange peel.Not a bad rendition of the classic Belgian beer
Pale yellow, hazy. Light bodied, very drinkable. Nice spicyness, and good citrus flavour. This is very much a Belgian style wit.

Tastes like Hoegaarden.
I didnt care for it.
Spicy start/nice citru tones; urine nose (!); beautiful head; hard to get past that aroma; becomes astringent halfway through
I enjoy Witbier very much.  This beer just didnt do it for me.  Had a finish that reminded me of lemon pledge.  Not a big fan

A very good witbier on par with Hoegaarden.  Great spicy and lemony aromas, head was a bit thin.  Good cloudy straw color with medium body.  Definite lemon flavor with some bitterness and light spices.  Not my favorite style by a long shot, but this was good and easily drinkable.
My first witbier.  An interesting blend of flavors.  Different to say the least.  you should swirl the bottle before you pour most of the beer (like the label says)..  not bad overall.  Enjoyable

Cloudy yellow, very sweet, spicy aroma. Very spicy, clovey for sure, wheat stands out,nice along with a nice smooth citrus twang!(Orange peel and coriander?)  And a little hoppy ending to finish it up...good white here boys......
UPDATED: NOV 28, 2004 On tap at the Moan and Dove:  Cloudy yellow with a large white head.  Lemony citrus aroma, lively carbonation, ends fairly dry.
A very tangy example of a wit with a strong clove presence. Tried it back to back with Victorys Whirlwind Wit and it more than held its own.

A very spicy wheat, citrus flavor makes a very good combination with the spicy body. Hoppier than most wheats. I enjoyed it. I dont generally think that a beer of this style is capable of earning anything higher than a 15/20 on my scale, so take that for what it is worth.

I was really looking forward to drinkning this. Nice spicy citrus flavor and great looks. A little too lemony perhaps. Very nice variation on the Belgian white but not my favorite, I guess I was expecting too much.

This beer can be categorized by one word: extreme.  Extreme cloves aroma accompany the very pale yellow, cloudy appearance.The aroma preceeds the taste which is also quite extreme: spice, ginger, and paprika are all present, and in bold style.  There is also a lemon effervesence that could probably be toned down a notch.  Overall, a very interesting experience, but a regular drinking beer? Too damn extreme.

UPDATED: OCT 17, 2003 Soft coriander aroma with hints of earthy hops.  Medium-light body. Lemon peel and doughy yeast flavors alongside softened notes of coriander and leafy noble hops.  Above  average.
user_location: Blue Ridge Mountains, North Carolina, USA

text:
UPDATED: MAR 20, 2004 June-Aug 01: Certainly well above average, but I'm a bit puzzled by others' extatic responses; one of the more strongly flavored, fuller-bodied whites, with a wonderful nose, but the sting of the aftertaste hurts it a bit for me.  Still, a good alternative to Paulaner Hefeweizen, esp. if cheaper.  8/8 New Tasting.  This beer improved a bit 2nd time; I've been drinking hoppier beers lately and getting more used to the 'kick' in the aftertaste; also, the lemony, breadlike aroma/flavor got me more this time.  Now if I can find their other beers...10/4/8/4/17=4.3

March 04:  Hadn't looked at this review in a while.  Amazed I rated it so high.  Early days...Anyway it's quite pleasant, the orangey aroma's the best part; bit more sour than the typical wit; above average but not a masterpiece...a great summer session beer for me.
Perfection in a bottle, Whogarden?

I like the citrusy nature of this beer, which is more interesting and subtle than that of the Sam Adams Summer Ale that I had the other day. I like the spicy kick in the aftertaste, which even though this is a summer brew put me in mind of Christmastime. So my overall reaction is more positive than that of my good friend and esteemed colleague muzzlehatch.

Good aroma.  Nice golden straw color.  Taste: noticed a slight lemon aftertaste. That, combined with the high carbonation, made the brew taste almost like Alka Seltzer plus cold medicine.  Overall, it had nice body, good potential, but could not get over that aftertaste.  I am completely puzzled by its great reviews.  Ill take Blanche de Chambly anyday.
UPDATED: MAY 27, 2013 Crisp and refreshing Belgian Wit. Pleasantly spiced. Very flavorful and easy to drink.

Nice color and aroma to this white beer.  The
flavor is wonderful and the finish is excellent with
a long lasting mix of spice and sweet orange.
OH MY. Something this good from the U.S.? Something this good from Maine?  This is a must try it is a very good beer know matter where its from. make me be proud to be from Maine :)

After hearing many good things about this beer, the first tasting was not a dissapointing.  A true to style Belgian white.  Beatiful cloudy colour.  Light and delicate with an emphasis on the coriander.  Subtle orange flavour at first with a pleasant spice in the finish.
I thought the Belgian Hoegaarden was the best white beer out there until I had this...beautiful, foamy head (cloudy) with a citrusy taste that lingers on the palate!
I am amazed that something this good came out of the U.S.  This beer has an amazing palate that lingers long after youve finished.  This is a beautiful white beer that can rival any imported.

UPDATED: APR 24, 2007 Credit goes to ratebeer.com and the
Featured Beer page for convincing me
to seek this beer out.  Wow.
Clean, yet full of character and complex
spices.  Great light yellow cloudiness.
WOW.  Thats all I have to say about this beer.  That and sammys seems to have the description down on this one.  An amazing white made in MAINE.

This is a wonderful beer.  After having spent some time in Brugge and having a certain affection for Witbier, this is a welcome treat, since most Wits are not imported to the US.  Who needs Hoegaarden when they make this stuff down the road a few miles?  I would rate this on par with, if not even a little bit better than Hoegaarden.  Nice aroma, nice spicy touch, great cloudy color...A fabulous brew!

A virtual unknown has come out of nowhere and won my weiss beer heart.  This is an amazing brew from start to finish.  Full of body, flavor and smooth.  If you can find this (looks like its available in select areas in the northeast US), I highly recommend it.
